<div class="mw-body-content mw-content-ltr" dir="ltr" id="mw-content-text" lang="en"><div class="mw-parser-output"><div class="shortdescription nomobile noexcerpt noprint searchaux" style="display:none">Most populous city in the United States</div>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1033289096">.mw-parser-output .hatnote{font-style:italic}.mw-parser-output div.hatnote{padding-left:1.6em;margin-bottom:0.5em}.mw-parser-output .hatnote i{font-style:normal}.mw-parser-output .hatnote+link+.hatnote{margin-top:-0.5em}</style><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">"NYC" and "New York, New York" redirect here. For other uses, see <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/New_York_City_(disambiguation)" title="New York City (disambiguation)">New York City (disambiguation)</a>; <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/NYC_(disambiguation)" title="NYC (disambiguation)">NYC (disambiguation)</a>; and <a class="mw-disambig" href="/wiki/New_York,_New_York_(disambiguation)" title="New York, New York (disambiguation)">New York, New York (disambiguation)</a>.</div>
<p class="mw-empty-elt">

href="#cite_note-NYC_POP_EST_2021-4">[4]</a></sup></div></th><td class="infobox-data">8,467,513</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"> • Rank</th><td class="infobox-data"><a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population" title="List of United States cities by population">1st</a> in the United States<br/><a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_in_New_York" title="List of cities in New York">1st</a> in New York State</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"> • Density</th><td class="infobox-data">29,302.66/sq mi (11,313.81/km<sup>2</sup>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"> • <a href="/wiki/Metropolitan_area" title="Metropolitan area">Metro</a><div class="ib-settlement-fn"><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2020Pop_5-0"><a href="#cite_note-2020Pop-5">[5]</a></sup></div></th><td class="infobox-data">20,140,470 (<a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/List_of_Metropolitan_Statistical_Areas" title="List of Metropolitan Statistical Areas">1st</a>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><th class="infobox-label" Time Zone">EST</a>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"><span class="nowrap"> • Summer (<a href="/wiki/Daylight_saving_time" title="Daylight saving time">DST</a>)</span></th><td class="infobox-data"><a href="/wiki/UTC%E2%88%9204:00" title="UTC−04:00">UTC−04:00</a> (<a href="/wiki/Eastern_Time_Zone" title="Eastern Time Zone">EDT</a>)</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row"><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/GDP" title="GDP">GDP</a> (City, 2020)</th><td class="infobox-data">$830 billion<sup class="reference" href="#cite_note-NYCMetroGMP-7">[7]</a></sup> (1st)</td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row">Largest <a href="/wiki/Boroughs_of_New_York_City" title="Boroughs of New class="infobox-label" scope="row">Largest borough by population</th><td class="infobox-data"><a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">Brooklyn</a> (2020 Census 2,736,074)</td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row">Largest borough by <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/GDP" title="GDP">GDP</a> (2020)</th><td class="infobox-data"><a href="/wiki/Manhattan" title="Manhattan">Manhattan</a> ($610.4 billion)<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-bea.gov_6-1"><a href="#cite_note-bea.gov-6">[6]</a></sup></td></tr><tr class="mergedtoprow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row">Website</th><td class="infobox-data"><span class="url"><a class="external text" href="https://www.nyc.gov" rel="nofollow">www<wbr/>.nyc<wbr/>.gov</a></span></td></tr><tr><td class="infobox-below" colspan="2"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1066479718" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></td></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th class="infobox-header" colspan="2"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1066479718" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div style="border:4px solid #FFE153; line-height: 1.5; text-align: center;">
<a href="/wiki/World_Heritage_Site" title="World Heritage Site">UNESCO World Heritage Site</a></div></th></tr><tr class="mergedrow"><th class="infobox-label" scope="row">Official name</th><td class="infobox-data"><div><ul><li><a href="/wiki/Statue_of_Liberty" title="Statue of Liberty">Statue of Liberty</a></li><li><a href="/wiki/Solomon_R._Guggenheim_Museum" title="Solomon R. </th></tr><tr style="display:none"><td colspan="2">

</tr><tr><td class="sidebar-navbar"><style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r1063604349">.mw-parser-output .navbar{display:inline;font-size:88%;font-weight:normal}.mw-parser-output .navbar-collapse{float:left;text-align:left}.mw-parser-output .navbar-boxtext{word-spacing:0}.mw-parser-output .navbar ul{display:inline-block;white-space:nowrap;line-height:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::before{margin-right:-0.125em;content:"[ "}.mw-parser-output .navbar-brackets::after{margin-left:-0.125em;content:" ]"}.mw-parser-output .navbar li{word-spacing:-0.125em}.mw-parser-output .navbar a>span,.mw-parser-output .navbar a>abbr{text-decoration:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-mini abbr{font-variant:small-caps;border-bottom:none;text-decoration:none;cursor:inherit}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-full{font-size:114%;margin:0 7em}.mw-parser-output .navbar-ct-mini{font-size:114%;margin:0 4em}</style><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Regions_of_New_York" title="Template:Regions of New York"><abbr title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Regions_of_New_York" title="Template talk:Regions of New York"><abbr title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Regions_of_New_York&amp;action=edit"><abbr title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div></td></tr></tbody></table>
<p><b>New York</b>, often called <b>New York City</b> (<b>NYC</b>) to distinguish it from the <a href="/wiki/New_York_(state)" title="New York (state)">State of New York</a>, is the <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population" title="List of United States cities by population">most populous city</a> in the United States. With a 2020 population of 8,804,190 distributed over 300.46 square miles (778.2 km<sup>2</sup>), New York City is also the <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population_density" title="List of United States cities by population density">most densely populated</a> major city in the United States. Located at the southern tip of New York State, the city is the center of the <a href="/wiki/New_York_metropolitan_area" title="New York metropolitan area">New York metropolitan area</a>, the largest <a href="/wiki/Metropolitan_area" title="Metropolitan area">metropolitan area</a> in the world by <a href="/wiki/Urban_area" title="Urban area">urban landmass</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-8"><a href="#cite_note-8">[8]</a></sup> With over 20.1 million people in its <a href="/wiki/Metropolitan_statistical_area" title="Metropolitan statistical area">metropolitan statistical area</a> and 23.5 million in its <a href="/wiki/Combined_statistical_area" title="Combined statistical area">combined statistical area</a> as of 2020, New York is one of the world's most populous <a href="/wiki/Megacity" title="Megacity">megacities</a>. New York City is a <a href="/wiki/Global_city" title="Global city">global</a> <a href="/wiki/Culture_of_New_York_City" title="Culture of New York City">cultural</a>, financial, and <a href="/wiki/Media_in_New_York_City" title="Media in New York City">media</a> center with a significant influence on commerce, <a href="/wiki/The_Entertainment_Capital_of_the_World" title="The Entertainment Capital of the World">entertainment</a>, research, technology,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-9"><a href="#cite_note-9">[9]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Education_in_New_York_City" title="Education in New York City">education</a>, <a href="/wiki/Politics_of_New_York_City" title="Politics of New York City">politics</a>, <a href="/wiki/Tourism_in_New_York_City" title="Tourism in New York City">tourism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Cuisine_of_New_York_City" title="Cuisine of New York City">dining</a>, <a href="/wiki/Art" title="Art">art</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fashion_capital" title="Fashion capital">fashion</a>, and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sports_in_New_York_City" title="Sports in New York City">sports</a>. New York is the most photographed city in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-10"><a href="#cite_note-10">[10]</a></sup> Home to the <a href="/wiki/Headquarters_of_the_United_Nations" title="Headquarters of the United Nations">headquarters of the United Nations</a>, New York is an important center for <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/International_diplomacy" title="International diplomacy">international diplomacy</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-11"><a href="#cite_note-11">[11]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-12"><a href="#cite_note-12">[12]</a></sup> an established <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Safe_haven_currency" title="Safe haven currency">safe haven</a> for global investors,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NewYorkSafeHaven_13-0"><a href="#cite_note-NewYorkSafeHaven-13">[13]</a></sup> and is <a href="/wiki/Caput_Mundi#New_York" title="Caput Mundi">sometimes described as the capital of the world</a>.
</p><p>Situated on <a href="/wiki/New_York_Harbor" title="New York Harbor">one of the world's largest natural harbors</a>, with water covering 36.4% of its surface area, New York City is composed of five boroughs, each of which is coextensive with a respective <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/County_of_the_state_of_New_York" title="County of the state of New York">county of the state of New York</a>. The five boroughs—<a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">Brooklyn</a> (Kings County), <a href="/wiki/Queens" title="Queens">Queens</a> (Queens County), <a href="/wiki/Manhattan" title="Manhattan">Manhattan</a> (New York County), <a href="/wiki/The_Bronx" title="The Bronx">the Bronx</a> (Bronx County), and <a href="/wiki/Staten_Island" title="Staten Island">Staten Island</a> (Richmond County)—were created when local governments were <a href="/wiki/City_of_Greater_New_York" title="City of Greater New York">consolidated</a> into a single municipal entity in 1898.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-14"><a href="#cite_note-14">[14]</a></sup> The city and its metropolitan area constitute the premier gateway for legal <a href="/wiki/Immigration_to_the_United_States" title="Immigration to the United States">immigration to the United States</a>. As many as 800 languages are spoken in New York,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-QueensMostLinguisticallyDiverse_15-0"><a href="#cite_note-QueensMostLinguisticallyDiverse-15">[15]</a></sup> making it the most linguistically diverse city in the world. New York is home to more than 3.2 million residents born outside the United States, the largest foreign-born population of any city in the world as of 2016.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCHighestForeignBorn_16-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCHighestForeignBorn-16">[16]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ons.gov.uk_17-0"><a href="#cite_note-ons.gov.uk-17">[17]</a></sup> As of 2018<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=New_York_City&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>, the New York metropolitan area is estimated to produce a <a href="/wiki/Gross_metropolitan_product" title="Gross metropolitan product">gross metropolitan product</a> (GMP) of nearly $1.8 trillion, ranking it <a href="/wiki/List_of_U.S._metropolitan_areas_by_GDP" title="List of U.S. metropolitan areas by GDP">first in the United States</a>. If the New York metropolitan area were a <a href="/wiki/Sovereign_state" title="Sovereign state">sovereign state</a>, it would have the <a href="/wiki/List_of_countries_by_GDP_(nominal)" title="List of countries by GDP (nominal)">eighth-largest economy</a> in the world. New York is home to the <a href="/wiki/List_of_cities_by_number_of_billionaires" title="List of cities by number of billionaires">highest number of billionaires</a> of any city in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-18"><a href="#cite_note-18">[18]</a></sup>
</p><p>New York City traces its origins to a trading post founded on the southern tip of Manhattan Island by <a href="/wiki/Dutch_Republic" title="Dutch Republic">Dutch</a> colonists in approximately 1624. The settlement was named <a href="/wiki/New_Amsterdam" title="New Amsterdam">New Amsterdam</a> (<a href="/wiki/Dutch_language" title="Dutch language">Dutch</a>: <i lang="nl"><a class="extiw" href="https://nl.wikipedia.org/wiki/Nieuw-Amsterdam_(Nieuw-Nederland)" title="nl:Nieuw-Amsterdam (Nieuw-Nederland)">Nieuw Amsterdam</a></i>) in 1626 and was chartered as a city in 1653. The city came under English control in 1664 and was renamed New York after King <a href="/wiki/Charles_II_of_England" title="Charles II of England">Charles II of England</a> granted the lands to his brother, the <a href="/wiki/James_II_of_England" title="James II of England">Duke of York</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-u-s-history.com_19-0"><a href="#cite_note-u-s-history.com-19">[19]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-npsnetherland_20-0"><a href="#cite_note-npsnetherland-20">[20]</a></sup> The city was regained by the Dutch in July 1673 and was renamed New Orange for one year and three months; the city has been continuously named New York since November 1674. New York City was the <a href="/wiki/List_of_capitals_in_the_United_States#Capitals_of_the_US" title="List of capitals in the United States">capital of the United States</a> from 1785 until 1790,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-senate_21-0"><a href="#cite_note-senate-21">[21]</a></sup> and has been the largest U.S. city since 1790. The <a href="/wiki/Statue_of_Liberty" title="Statue of Liberty">Statue of Liberty</a> greeted millions of immigrants as they came to the U.S. by ship in the late 19th and early 20th centuries, and is a symbol of the U.S. and its ideals of liberty and peace.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Statue_of_Liberty_UNESCO_22-0"><a href="#cite_note-Statue_of_Liberty_UNESCO-22">[22]</a></sup> In the 21st century, New York has emerged as a global node of creativity, entrepreneurship,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-VentureCapitalNY1_23-0"><a href="#cite_note-VentureCapitalNY1-23">[23]</a></sup> and environmental sustainability,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-EnvironmentalSustainabilityNY1_24-0"><a href="#cite_note-EnvironmentalSustainabilityNY1-24">[24]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-EnvironmentalSustainabilityNY2_25-0"><a href="#cite_note-EnvironmentalSustainabilityNY2-25">[25]</a></sup> and as a symbol of freedom and cultural diversity.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-26"><a href="#cite_note-26">[26]</a></sup> <i><a href="/wiki/The_New_York_Times" title="The New York Times">The New York Times</a></i> has won the most <a href="/wiki/Pulitzer_Prize" title="Pulitzer Prize">Pulitzer Prizes</a> for <a href="/wiki/New_Yorkers_in_journalism" title="New Yorkers in journalism">journalism</a> and remains the U.S. media's "newspaper of record".<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYTNewspaperOfRecord_27-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYTNewspaperOfRecord-27">[27]</a></sup> In 2019, New York was voted the greatest city in the world per a survey of over 30,000 people from 48 cities worldwide, citing its cultural diversity.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCWorld_28-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCWorld-28">[28]</a></sup>
</p><p>Many <a href="/wiki/Lists_of_New_York_City_landmarks" title="Lists of New York City landmarks">districts and monuments</a> in New York City are major landmarks, including three of the world's ten most visited tourist attractions in 2013.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Ann_Shields_29-0"><a href="#cite_note-Ann_Shields-29">[29]</a></sup> A record 66.6 million tourists visited New York City in 2019. <a href="/wiki/Times_Square" title="Times Square">Times Square</a> is the brightly illuminated hub of the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Broadway_Theater_District" title="Broadway Theater District">Broadway Theater District</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-30"><a href="#cite_note-30">[30]</a></sup> one of the world's busiest pedestrian intersections,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Ann_Shields_29-1"><a href="#cite_note-Ann_Shields-29">[29]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-31"><a href="#cite_note-31">[31]</a></sup> and a major center of the world's <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Entertainment_industry" title="Entertainment industry">entertainment industry</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-32"><a href="#cite_note-32">[32]</a></sup> Many of the city's landmarks, <a href="/wiki/List_of_tallest_buildings_in_New_York_City" title="List of tallest buildings in New York City">skyscrapers</a>, and <a href="/wiki/List_of_New_York_City_parks" title="List of New York City parks">parks</a> are known around the world, as is the city's fast pace, spawning the term <i><a class="extiw" href="https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/New_York_minute" title="wikt:New York minute">New York minute</a></i>. The <a href="/wiki/Empire_State_Building" title="Empire State Building">Empire State Building</a> has become the global standard of reference to describe the height and length of other structures.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-EmpireStateMulti_33-0"><a href="#cite_note-EmpireStateMulti-33">[33]</a></sup> The <a href="/wiki/Stonewall_Inn" title="Stonewall Inn">Stonewall Inn</a> in <a href="/wiki/Greenwich_Village" title="Greenwich Village">Greenwich Village</a>, part of the <a href="/wiki/Stonewall_National_Monument" title="Stonewall National Monument">Stonewall National Monument</a>, is considered the historic epicenter of <a href="/wiki/LGBT_culture_in_New_York_City" title="LGBT culture in New York City">LGBTQ+ culture</a> and the <a href="/wiki/Stonewall_riots" title="Stonewall riots">birthplace</a> of the modern <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gay_rights_movement" title="Gay rights movement">gay rights movement</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-autogenerated3_34-0"><a href="#cite_note-autogenerated3-34">[34]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-35"><a href="#cite_note-35">[35]</a></sup> Manhattan's real estate market is among the most expensive in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-36"><a href="#cite_note-36">[36]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-37"><a href="#cite_note-37">[37]</a></sup> Providing continuous 24/7 service and contributing to the <a href="/wiki/Nicknames_of_New_York_City" title="Nicknames of New York City">nickname</a> <i><a href="/wiki/The_City_That_Never_Sleeps_(nickname)" title="The City That Never Sleeps (nickname)">The City That Never Sleeps</a></i>, the <a href="/wiki/New_York_City_Subway" title="New York City Subway">New York City Subway</a> is the largest single-operator <a href="/wiki/Rapid_transit" title="Rapid transit">rapid transit</a> system worldwide, with 472 <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Rail_station" title="Rail station">passenger rail stations</a>; and <a href="/wiki/Pennsylvania_Station_(New_York_City)" title="Pennsylvania Station (New York City)">Penn Station</a> in <a href="/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan" title="Midtown Manhattan">Midtown Manhattan</a> is the busiest transportation hub in the <a href="/wiki/Western_Hemisphere" title="Western Hemisphere">Western Hemisphere</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-38"><a href="#cite_note-38">[38]</a></sup> The city has <a href="/wiki/List_of_colleges_and_universities_in_New_York_City" title="List of colleges and universities in New York City">over 120 colleges and universities</a>, including <a href="/wiki/Columbia_University" title="Columbia University">Columbia University</a>, <a href="/wiki/New_York_University" title="New York University">New York University</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/City_University_of_New_York" title="City University of New York">City University of New York</a> system, which is the largest urban public university system in the United States. Anchored by <a href="/wiki/Wall_Street" title="Wall Street">Wall Street</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Financial_District,_Manhattan" title="Financial District, Manhattan">Financial District</a> of <a href="/wiki/Lower_Manhattan" title="Lower Manhattan">Lower Manhattan</a>, New York City has been called both the world's leading <a href="/wiki/Financial_centre" title="Financial centre">financial center</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCFinancialCapitalWorld_39-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCFinancialCapitalWorld-39">[39]</a></sup>and the most powerful city in the world,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NewYorkMostPowerfulGlobalCity_40-0"><a href="#cite_note-NewYorkMostPowerfulGlobalCity-40">[40]</a></sup> and is home to the world's two <a href="/wiki/List_of_stock_exchanges" title="List of stock exchanges">largest stock exchanges</a> by total <a href="/wiki/Market_capitalization" title="Market capitalization">market capitalization</a>, the <a href="/wiki/New_York_Stock_Exchange" title="New York Stock Exchange">New York Stock Exchange</a> and <a href="/wiki/Nasdaq" title="Nasdaq">Nasdaq</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-41"><a href="#cite_note-41">[41]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-42"><a href="#cite_note-42">[42]</a></sup>
</p>
<style data-mw-deduplicate="TemplateStyles:r886046785">.mw-parser-output .toclimit-2 .toclevel-1 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-3 .toclevel-2 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-4 .toclevel-3 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-5 .toclevel-4 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-6 .toclevel-5 ul,.mw-parser-output .toclimit-7 .toclevel-6 ul{display:none}</style><div class="toclimit-3"><div aria-labelledby="mw-toc-heading" class="toc" id="toc" role="navigation"><input class="toctogglecheckbox" id="toctogglecheckbox" role="button" style="display:none" type="checkbox"/><div class="toctitle" dir="ltr" lang="en"><h2 id="mw-toc-heading">Contents</h2><span class="toctogglespan"><label class="toctogglelabel" for="toctogglecheckbox"></label></span></div>

<li class="toclevel-1 tocsection-66"><a href="#Transportation"><span class="tocnumber">11</span> <span class="toctext">Transportation</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-2 tocsection-67"><a href="#Rapid_transit"><span class="tocnumber">11.1</span> <span class="toctext">Rapid transit</span></a>
<ul>
<li class="toclevel-3 tocsection-68"><a href="#Rail"><span class="tocnumber">11.1.1</span> <span class="toctext">Rail</span></a></li>
