<p>New York City is the most populous city in the United States,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2014NYCest2_250-0"><a href="#cite_note-2014NYCest2-250">[248]</a></sup> with 8,804,190 residents<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2020Census_246-1"><a href="#cite_note-2020Census-246">[244]</a></sup> incorporating more immigration into the city than outmigration since the <a href="/wiki/2010_United_States_census" title="2010 United States census">2010 United States census</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-251"><a href="#cite_note-251">[249]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-nytimes_a_252-0"><a href="#cite_note-nytimes_a-252">[250]</a></sup> More than twice as many people live in New York City as compared to <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles" title="Los Angeles">Los Angeles</a>, the second-most populous U.S. city,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2014NYCest2_250-1"><a href="#cite_note-2014NYCest2-250">[248]</a></sup> and within a smaller area. New York City gained more residents between 2010 and 2020 (629,000) than any other U.S. city, and a greater amount than the total sum of the gains over the same decade of the next four largest U.S. cities, Los Angeles, <a href="/wiki/Chicago" title="Chicago">Chicago</a>, <a href="/wiki/Houston" title="Houston">Houston</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Phoenix,_Arizona" title="Phoenix, Arizona">Phoenix, Arizona</a> combined.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2010to2020CensusGrowth1_253-0"><a href="#cite_note-2010to2020CensusGrowth1-253">[251]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-2010to2020CensusGrowth2_254-0"><a href="#cite_note-2010to2020CensusGrowth2-254">[252]</a></sup> New York City's population is about 44% of New York State's population,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PopHousingEst_255-0"><a href="#cite_note-PopHousingEst-255">[253]</a></sup> and about 39% of the population of the <a href="/wiki/New_York_metropolitan_area" title="New York metropolitan area">New York metropolitan area</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-PopHousingEstMetro_256-0"><a href="#cite_note-PopHousingEstMetro-256">[254]</a></sup> The majority of New York City residents in 2020 (5,141,538, or 58.4%) were living on <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">Long Island</a>, in Brooklyn, or in Queens.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LINYCpopulation_257-0"><a href="#cite_note-LINYCpopulation-257">[255]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Population_density">Population density</span></h3>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Broadway_Crowds_(5896264776)_crop.jpg"><img alt="Looking at crowds down Broadway" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2581" data-file-width="3799" decoding="async" height="204" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Broadway_Crowds_%285896264776%29_crop.jpg/300px-Broadway_Crowds_%285896264776%29_crop.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Broadway_Crowds_%285896264776%29_crop.jpg/450px-Broadway_Crowds_%285896264776%29_crop.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c9/Broadway_Crowds_%285896264776%29_crop.jpg/600px-Broadway_Crowds_%285896264776%29_crop.jpg 2x" width="300"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Broadway_Crowds_(5896264776)_crop.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>Looking down <a href="/wiki/Broadway_(Manhattan)" title="Broadway (Manhattan)">Broadway</a> in <a href="/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan" title="Midtown Manhattan">Midtown Manhattan</a>. New York City had an estimated <a href="/wiki/Population_density" title="Population density">population density</a> of 29,302.37 inhabitants per square mile (11,313.71/km<sup>2</sup>) in 2020, as the most densely populated major U.S. city. <a href="/wiki/Manhattan" title="Manhattan">Manhattan</a> (New York County) alone was home to 74,870.7 inhabitants per square mile (28,907.7/km<sup>2</sup>), rendering it the most densely populated <a href="/wiki/Municipality" title="Municipality">municipality</a> in the United States.</div></div></div>
<p>In 2020, the city had an estimated population density of 29,302.37 inhabitants per square mile (11,313.71/km<sup>2</sup>), rendering it the nation's most densely populated of all larger municipalities (those with more than 100,000 residents), with several small cities (of fewer than 100,000) in adjacent <a href="/wiki/Hudson_County,_New_Jersey" title="Hudson County, New Jersey">Hudson County, New Jersey</a> having <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population_density" title="List of United States cities by population density">greater density</a>, as per the 2010 census.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-258"><a href="#cite_note-258">[256]</a></sup> Geographically co-extensive with New York County, the borough of Manhattan's 2017 population density of 72,918 inhabitants per square mile (28,154/km<sup>2</sup>) makes it the <a href="/wiki/County_statistics_of_the_United_States#Population_density" title="County statistics of the United States">highest of any county in the United States</a> and <a href="/wiki/List_of_United_States_cities_by_population_density#New_York_City_boroughs" title="List of United States cities by population density">higher than the density of any individual American city</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-259"><a href="#cite_note-259">[257]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-260"><a href="#cite_note-260">[258]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-261"><a href="#cite_note-261">[259]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-262"><a href="#cite_note-262">[260]</a></sup> The next three densest counties in the United States, placing second through fourth, are also New York boroughs: Brooklyn, the Bronx, and Queens respectively.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-census2010_263-0"><a href="#cite_note-census2010-263">[261]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Race_and_ethnicity">Race and ethnicity</span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Category:Ethnic_groups_in_New_York_City" title="Category:Ethnic groups in New York City">Category:Ethnic groups in New York City</a>, <a href="/wiki/African_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="African Americans in New York City">African Americans in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bangladeshis_in_New_York_City" title="Bangladeshis in New York City">Bangladeshis in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Caribbeans_in_New_York_City" title="Caribbeans in New York City">Caribbeans in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_in_New_York_City" title="Chinese in New York City">Chinese in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dominican_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Dominican Americans in New York City">Dominican Americans in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Filipinos_in_New_York_City" title="Filipinos in New York City">Filipinos in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Fuzhounese_in_New_York_City" title="Fuzhounese in New York City">Fuzhounese in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indians_in_New_York_City" title="Indians in New York City">Indians in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Irish_in_New_York_City" title="Irish in New York City">Irish in New York City</a>, <a href="/wiki/Italians_in_New_York_City" title="Italians in New York City">Italians in New York City</a>, <a href="/wiki/Japanese_in_New_York_City" title="Japanese in New York City">Japanese in New York City</a>, <a href="/wiki/Koreans_in_New_York_City" title="Koreans in New York City">Koreans in New York City</a>, <a href="/wiki/Puerto_Ricans_in_New_York_City" title="Puerto Ricans in New York City">Puerto Ricans in New York City</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Russians_in_New_York_City" title="Russians in New York City">Russians in New York City</a>, and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ukrainians_in_New_York_City" title="Ukrainians in New York City">Ukrainians in New York City</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="533" data-file-width="1200" decoding="async" height="133" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra.jpg/300px-Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra.jpg/450px-Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b3/Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra.jpg/600px-Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra.jpg 2x" width="300"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Spanish_Harlem" title="Spanish Harlem">Spanish Harlem</a> <a href="/wiki/Spanish_Harlem_Orchestra" title="Spanish Harlem Orchestra">Orchestra</a>. New York City is home to nearly 3 million <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Latino_Americans" title="Latino Americans">Latino Americans</a>, the largest <a href="/wiki/Hispanic" title="Hispanic">Hispanic</a> population of any city outside <a href="/wiki/Latin_America" title="Latin America">Latin America</a> and <a href="/wiki/Spain" title="Spain">Spain</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>The city's population in 2020 was 30.9% <a href="/wiki/White_Americans" title="White Americans">White</a> (non-Hispanic), 28.7% <a href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_Americans" title="Hispanic and Latino Americans">Hispanic or Latino</a>, 20.2% <a href="/wiki/African_Americans" title="African Americans">Black or African American</a> (non-Hispanic), 15.6% <a href="/wiki/Asian_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Asian Americans in New York City">Asian</a>, and 0.2% <a href="/wiki/Native_Americans_in_the_United_States" title="Native Americans in the United States">Native American</a> (non-Hispanic).<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-264"><a href="#cite_note-264">[262]</a></sup> A total of 3.4% of the non-Hispanic population identified with <a href="/wiki/Multiracial_Americans" title="Multiracial Americans">more than one race</a>. Throughout its history, New York has been a major <a href="/wiki/Port_of_entry" title="Port of entry">port of entry</a> for immigrants into the United States. More than 12 million <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/European_American" title="European American">European</a> immigrants were received at <a href="/wiki/Ellis_Island" title="Ellis Island">Ellis Island</a> between 1892 and 1924.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-265"><a href="#cite_note-265">[263]</a></sup> The term "<a href="/wiki/Melting_pot" title="Melting pot">melting pot</a>" was first coined to describe densely populated immigrant neighborhoods on the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lower_East_Side,_Manhattan" title="Lower East Side, Manhattan">Lower East Side</a>. By 1900, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/German_American" title="German American">Germans</a> constituted the largest immigrant group, followed by the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Irish_American" title="Irish American">Irish</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ashkenazi_Jews" title="Ashkenazi Jews">Jews</a>, and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Italian_American" title="Italian American">Italians</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-266"><a href="#cite_note-266">[264]</a></sup> In 1940, Whites represented 92% of the city's population.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-pop_249-3"><a href="#cite_note-pop-249">[247]</a></sup>
</p><p>Approximately 37% of the city's population is <a href="/wiki/Foreign_born" title="Foreign born">foreign born</a>, and more than half of all children are born to mothers who are immigrants as of 2013.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CityDiversity_267-0"><a href="#cite_note-CityDiversity-267">[265]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYC_immigration_268-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYC_immigration-268">[266]</a></sup> In New York, no single country or region of origin dominates.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-CityDiversity_267-1"><a href="#cite_note-CityDiversity-267">[265]</a></sup> The ten largest sources of foreign-born individuals in the city as of 2011<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=New_York_City&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup> were the <a href="/wiki/Dominican_Republic" title="Dominican Republic">Dominican Republic</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Chinese Americans in New York City">China</a>, Mexico, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Guyanese_American" title="Guyanese American">Guyana</a>, <a href="/wiki/Jamaica" title="Jamaica">Jamaica</a>, <a href="/wiki/Ecuador" title="Ecuador">Ecuador</a>, <a href="/wiki/Haiti" title="Haiti">Haiti</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indians_in_the_New_York_City_metropolitan_region" title="Indians in the New York City metropolitan region">India</a>, <a href="/wiki/Russian_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Russian Americans in New York City">Russia</a>, and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Caribbeans_in_New_York_City" title="Caribbeans in New York City">Trinidad and Tobago</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-269"><a href="#cite_note-269">[267]</a></sup> while the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bangladeshi_American" title="Bangladeshi American">Bangladeshi-born</a> immigrant population has become one of the fastest growing in the city, counting over 74,000 by 2011.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCHighestForeignBorn_16-1"><a href="#cite_note-NYCHighestForeignBorn-16">[16]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-270"><a href="#cite_note-270">[268]</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Asian_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Asian Americans in New York City">Asian Americans in New York City</a>, according to the 2010 census, number more than one million, greater than the combined totals of <a href="/wiki/San_Francisco" title="San Francisco">San Francisco</a> and <a href="/wiki/Los_Angeles" title="Los Angeles">Los Angeles</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-271"><a href="#cite_note-271">[269]</a></sup> New York contains the highest total Asian population of any U.S. city proper.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-272"><a href="#cite_note-272">[270]</a></sup> The New York City borough of Queens is home to the state's largest Asian American population and the largest <a href="/wiki/Andes" title="Andes">Andean</a> (<a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Colombian_American" title="Colombian American">Colombian</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ecuadorian_American" title="Ecuadorian American">Ecuadorian</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Peruvian_American" title="Peruvian American">Peruvian</a>, and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Bolivian_American" title="Bolivian American">Bolivian</a>) populations in the United States, and is also the most ethnically diverse urban area in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-QueensMostDiverseWorld1_168-1"><a href="#cite_note-QueensMostDiverseWorld1-168">[168]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-QueensMostDiverseWorld2_169-1"><a href="#cite_note-QueensMostDiverseWorld2-169">[169]</a></sup>
</p>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1096954695/mw-parser-output/.tmulti" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="thumb tmulti tleft"><div class="thumbinner multiimageinner" style="width:362px;max-width:362px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:179px;max-width:179px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:112px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Chinatown_manhattan_2009.JPG"><img alt="" data-file-height="2592" data-file-width="3872" decoding="async" height="118" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f5/Chinatown_manhattan_2009.JPG/177px-Chinatown_manhattan_2009.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f5/Chinatown_manhattan_2009.JPG/266px-Chinatown_manhattan_2009.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/f/f5/Chinatown_manhattan_2009.JPG/354px-Chinatown_manhattan_2009.JPG 2x" width="177"/></a></div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:179px;max-width:179px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:112px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Little_Italy_NY_Street.JPG"><img alt="" data-file-height="3456" data-file-width="4608" decoding="async" height="133" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e4/Little_Italy_NY_Street.JPG/177px-Little_Italy_NY_Street.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e4/Little_Italy_NY_Street.JPG/266px-Little_Italy_NY_Street.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/e4/Little_Italy_NY_Street.JPG/354px-Little_Italy_NY_Street.JPG 2x" width="177"/></a></div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:179px;max-width:179px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:112px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:USA-NYC-Koreatown99.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="3456" data-file-width="5184" decoding="async" height="118" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/USA-NYC-Koreatown99.jpg/177px-USA-NYC-Koreatown99.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/USA-NYC-Koreatown99.jpg/266px-USA-NYC-Koreatown99.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/a/af/USA-NYC-Koreatown99.jpg/354px-USA-NYC-Koreatown99.jpg 2x" width="177"/></a></div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:179px;max-width:179px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:112px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Elbarrio116thLex.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="1089" data-file-width="1440" decoding="async" height="134" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Elbarrio116thLex.jpg/177px-Elbarrio116thLex.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Elbarrio116thLex.jpg/266px-Elbarrio116thLex.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/c6/Elbarrio116thLex.jpg/354px-Elbarrio116thLex.jpg 2x" width="177"/></a></div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:179px;max-width:179px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:112px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Storefront_of_NY_Central_Pharmacy.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="1694" data-file-width="1588" decoding="async" height="189" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Storefront_of_NY_Central_Pharmacy.jpg/177px-Storefront_of_NY_Central_Pharmacy.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Storefront_of_NY_Central_Pharmacy.jpg/266px-Storefront_of_NY_Central_Pharmacy.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/16/Storefront_of_NY_Central_Pharmacy.jpg/354px-Storefront_of_NY_Central_Pharmacy.jpg 2x" width="177"/></a></div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:179px;max-width:179px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:112px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:74th_St_shopping_Jax_Hts_jeh.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="3456" data-file-width="4608" decoding="async" height="133" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/74th_St_shopping_Jax_Hts_jeh.jpg/177px-74th_St_shopping_Jax_Hts_jeh.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/74th_St_shopping_Jax_Hts_jeh.jpg/266px-74th_St_shopping_Jax_Hts_jeh.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/14/74th_St_shopping_Jax_Hts_jeh.jpg/354px-74th_St_shopping_Jax_Hts_jeh.jpg 2x" width="177"/></a></div></div></div><div class="trow" style="display:flex"><div class="thumbcaption">Clockwise, from upper left: <a href="/wiki/Chinatown,_Manhattan" title="Chinatown, Manhattan">Chinatown, Manhattan (曼哈頓華埠)</a>, home to the <a href="/wiki/Chinese_people_in_New_York_City" title="Chinese people in New York City">highest concentration of Chinese people in the Western Hemisphere</a>;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-ManhattanChinatownLargestConcentrationChineseWesternHemisphere_273-0"><a href="#cite_note-ManhattanChinatownLargestConcentrationChineseWesternHemisphere-273">[271]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-fact-sheet_274-0"><a href="#cite_note-fact-sheet-274">[272]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Lower_Manhattan" title="Lower Manhattan">Lower Manhattan</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Little_Italy,_Manhattan" title="Little Italy, Manhattan">Little Italy</a>; <a href="/wiki/Upper_Manhattan" title="Upper Manhattan">Upper Manhattan</a>'s <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Spanish_Harlem" title="Spanish Harlem">Spanish Harlem</a>; <a href="/wiki/Jackson_Heights,_Queens" title="Jackson Heights, Queens">Little India, Queens</a>; <a href="/wiki/Brighton_Beach#Russian-speaking_cultures" title="Brighton Beach">Little Russia, Brooklyn</a>; and <a href="/wiki/Koreatown,_Manhattan" title="Koreatown, Manhattan">Koreatown (코리아타운)</a>, <a href="/wiki/Midtown_Manhattan" title="Midtown Manhattan">Midtown Manhattan</a></div></div></div></div>
<p>The Chinese population constitutes the fastest-growing nationality in New York State; multiple satellites of the original <a href="/wiki/Chinatown,_Manhattan" title="Chinatown, Manhattan">Manhattan Chinatown</a>, in <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinatown,_Brooklyn" title="Chinatown, Brooklyn">Brooklyn</a>, and around <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinatown,_Flushing" title="Chinatown, Flushing">Flushing, Queens</a>, are thriving as traditionally urban enclaves—while also expanding rapidly eastward into suburban <a href="/wiki/Nassau_County,_New_York" title="Nassau County, New York">Nassau County</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-275"><a href="#cite_note-275">[273]</a></sup> on <a href="/wiki/Long_Island" title="Long Island">Long Island</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-276"><a href="#cite_note-276">[274]</a></sup> as the New York metropolitan region and New York State have become the top destinations for new Chinese immigrants, respectively, and large-scale <a href="/wiki/Chinese_emigration" title="Chinese emigration">Chinese immigration</a> continues into New York City and surrounding areas,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Immigrants2014est_277-0"><a href="#cite_note-Immigrants2014est-277">[275]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_278-0"><a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-278">[276]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Chinese2013est_279-0"><a href="#cite_note-Chinese2013est-279">[277]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-280"><a href="#cite_note-280">[278]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-281"><a href="#cite_note-281">[279]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-282"><a href="#cite_note-282">[280]</a></sup> with the largest metropolitan Chinese diaspora outside Asia,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCHighestForeignBorn_16-2"><a href="#cite_note-NYCHighestForeignBorn-16">[16]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-283"><a href="#cite_note-283">[281]</a></sup> including an estimated 812,410 individuals in 2015.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-284"><a href="#cite_note-284">[282]</a></sup>
</p><p>In 2012, 6.3% of New York City was of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Chinese_American" title="Chinese American">Chinese ethnicity</a>, with nearly three-fourths living in either Queens or Brooklyn, geographically on Long Island.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-285"><a href="#cite_note-285">[283]</a></sup> A community numbering 20,000 <a href="/wiki/Koreans_in_China" title="Koreans in China">Korean-Chinese</a> (<i>Chaoxianzu</i> or <i>Joseonjok</i>) is centered in <a href="/wiki/Flushing,_Queens" title="Flushing, Queens">Flushing, Queens</a>, while New York City is also home to the largest <a href="/wiki/Tibetan_people" title="Tibetan people">Tibetan</a> population outside China, India, and <a href="/wiki/Nepal" title="Nepal">Nepal</a>, also centered in Queens.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UnreachedNY_286-0"><a href="#cite_note-UnreachedNY-286">[284]</a></sup> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Korean_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Korean Americans in New York City">Koreans</a> made up 1.2% of the city's population, and <a href="/wiki/Japanese_in_New_York_City" title="Japanese in New York City">Japanese</a> 0.3%. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Filipinos_in_the_New_York_City_metropolitan_region" title="Filipinos in the New York City metropolitan region">Filipinos</a> were the largest <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Southeast_Asian" title="Southeast Asian">Southeast Asian</a> ethnic group at 0.8%, followed by <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Vietnamese_American" title="Vietnamese American">Vietnamese</a>, who made up 0.2% of New York City's population in 2010. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indian_American" title="Indian American">Indians</a> are the largest <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/South_Asian" title="South Asian">South Asian</a> group, comprising 2.4% of the city's population, with Bangladeshis and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pakistani_American" title="Pakistani American">Pakistanis</a> at 0.7% and 0.5%, respectively.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-287"><a href="#cite_note-287">[285]</a></sup> Queens is the preferred borough of settlement for Asian Indians, Koreans, Filipinos and <a href="/wiki/Malaysian_Americans" title="Malaysian Americans">Malaysians</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-288"><a href="#cite_note-288">[286]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Immigrants2014est_277-1"><a href="#cite_note-Immigrants2014est-277">[275]</a></sup> and other Southeast Asians;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-289"><a href="#cite_note-289">[287]</a></sup> while Brooklyn is receiving large numbers of both <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/West_Indian_American" title="West Indian American">West Indian</a> and Asian Indian immigrants.
</p><p>New York City has the largest <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/European_American" title="European American">European</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Non-Hispanic_Whites" title="Non-Hispanic Whites">non-Hispanic White</a> population of any American city. At 2.7 million in 2012, New York's non-Hispanic White population is larger than the non-Hispanic White populations of Los Angeles (1.1 million), Chicago (865,000), and Houston (550,000) combined.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-290"><a href="#cite_note-290">[288]</a></sup> The non-Hispanic White population was 6.6 million in 1940.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-291"><a href="#cite_note-291">[289]</a></sup> The non-Hispanic White population has begun to increase since 2010.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-292"><a href="#cite_note-292">[290]</a></sup>
</p><p>The <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/European_diaspora" title="European diaspora">European diaspora</a> residing in the city is very diverse. According to 2012 census estimates, there were roughly 560,000 Italian Americans, 385,000 Irish Americans, 253,000 <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/German_American" title="German American">German Americans</a>, 223,000 <a href="/wiki/Russian_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Russian Americans in New York City">Russian Americans</a>, 201,000 <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Polish_American" title="Polish American">Polish Americans</a>, and 137,000 <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/English_American" title="English American">English Americans</a>. Additionally, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Greek_American" title="Greek American">Greek</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/French_American" title="French American">French Americans</a> numbered 65,000 each, with those of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hungarian_American" title="Hungarian American">Hungarian</a> descent estimated at 60,000 people. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ukrainian_American" title="Ukrainian American">Ukrainian</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Scottish_American" title="Scottish American">Scottish Americans</a> numbered 55,000 and 35,000, respectively. People identifying ancestry from Spain numbered 30,838 total in 2010.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HispanicLatino_293-0"><a href="#cite_note-HispanicLatino-293">[291]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Mirziyoyevning_Jahon_bankida_o%27zbekistonliklar_bilan_uchrashuvi.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="898" data-file-width="1597" decoding="async" height="169" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5e/Mirziyoyevning_Jahon_bankida_o%27zbekistonliklar_bilan_uchrashuvi.jpg/300px-Mirziyoyevning_Jahon_bankida_o%27zbekistonliklar_bilan_uchrashuvi.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5e/Mirziyoyevning_Jahon_bankida_o%27zbekistonliklar_bilan_uchrashuvi.jpg/450px-Mirziyoyevning_Jahon_bankida_o%27zbekistonliklar_bilan_uchrashuvi.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/5/5e/Mirziyoyevning_Jahon_bankida_o%27zbekistonliklar_bilan_uchrashuvi.jpg/600px-Mirziyoyevning_Jahon_bankida_o%27zbekistonliklar_bilan_uchrashuvi.jpg 2x" width="300"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Mirziyoyevning_Jahon_bankida_o%27zbekistonliklar_bilan_uchrashuvi.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Uzbekistan" title="Uzbekistan">Uzbekistan</a>'s president <a href="/wiki/Shavkat_Mirziyoyev" title="Shavkat Mirziyoyev">Shavkat Mirziyoyev</a> with members of the Uzbek diaspora in New York City, home to more than half of all <a href="/wiki/Uzbek_Americans" title="Uzbek Americans">Uzbek Americans</a>, most settling in <a href="/wiki/Queens" title="Queens">Queens</a> or <a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">Brooklyn</a></div></div></div>
<p>People of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Norwegian_American" title="Norwegian American">Norwegian</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Swedish_American" title="Swedish American">Swedish</a> descent both stood at about 20,000 each, while people of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Czech_American" title="Czech American">Czech</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lithuanian_American" title="Lithuanian American">Lithuanian</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Portuguese_American" title="Portuguese American">Portuguese</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Scotch-Irish_American" title="Scotch-Irish American">Scotch-Irish</a>, and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Welsh_American" title="Welsh American">Welsh</a> descent all numbered between 12,000 and 14,000.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-294"><a href="#cite_note-294">[292]</a></sup> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Arab_American" title="Arab American">Arab Americans</a> number over 160,000 in New York City,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-295"><a href="#cite_note-295">[293]</a></sup> with the highest concentration in Brooklyn. <a href="/wiki/Demographics_of_Central_Asia" title="Demographics of Central Asia">Central Asians</a>, primarily <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Uzbek_American" title="Uzbek American">Uzbek Americans</a>, are a rapidly growing segment of the city's non-Hispanic White population, enumerating over 30,000, and including more than half of all Central Asian immigrants to the United States,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-296"><a href="#cite_note-296">[294]</a></sup> most settling in Queens or Brooklyn. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Albanian_American" title="Albanian American">Albanian Americans</a> are most highly concentrated in the Bronx,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-297"><a href="#cite_note-297">[295]</a></sup> while <a href="/wiki/Astoria,_Queens" title="Astoria, Queens">Astoria, Queens</a> is the epicenter of American <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Greek_culture" title="Greek culture">Greek culture</a> as well as the <a href="/wiki/Greek_Cypriots" title="Greek Cypriots">Cypriot</a> community.
</p><p>The wider New York City metropolitan statistical area, with more than twenty million people, about fifty percent more than second-place <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Los_Angeles_metropolitan_area" title="Los Angeles metropolitan area">Los Angeles</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-census-est-nyc-ny_298-0"><a href="#cite_note-census-est-nyc-ny-298">[296]</a></sup> is also <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ethnic_diversity" title="Ethnic diversity">ethnically diverse</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-299"><a href="#cite_note-299">[297]</a></sup> with the largest <a href="/wiki/Foreign_born#Metropolitan_regions_with_largest_foreign_born_populations" title="Foreign born">foreign-born population of any metropolitan region</a> in the world. The New York region continues to be by far the leading metropolitan gateway for legal immigrants admitted into the United States, substantially exceeding the combined totals of Los Angeles and <a href="/wiki/Miami_metropolitan_area" title="Miami metropolitan area">Miami</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Immigrants2014est_277-2"><a href="#cite_note-Immigrants2014est-277">[275]</a></sup> It is home to the largest <a href="/wiki/Jews_in_New_York_City" title="Jews in New York City">Jewish</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Israeli_American" title="Israeli American">Israeli</a> communities outside Israel, with the Jewish population in the region numbering over 1.5 million in 2012 and including many diverse Jewish sects, predominantly from around the Middle East and Eastern Europe, and including a rapidly growing <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Orthodox_Jewish" title="Orthodox Jewish">Orthodox Jewish</a> population, the largest outside Israel.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-UnreachedNY_286-1"><a href="#cite_note-UnreachedNY-286">[284]</a></sup>
</p><p>The metropolitan area is also home to 20% of the nation's <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Indians_in_the_New_York_City_metropolitan_region" title="Indians in the New York City metropolitan region">Indian Americans</a> and at least 20 <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Little_India_(location)" title="Little India (location)">Little India</a> enclaves, and 15% of all <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Korean_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="Korean Americans in New York City">Korean Americans</a> and four <a href="/wiki/Koreatown,_Manhattan" title="Koreatown, Manhattan">Koreatowns</a>;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-factfinder2.census_300-0"><a href="#cite_note-factfinder2.census-300">[298]</a></sup> the largest <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Asian_Indian" title="Asian Indian">Asian Indian</a> population in the Western Hemisphere; the largest Russian American,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_278-1"><a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-278">[276]</a></sup> Italian American, and African American populations; the largest <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Dominican_American" title="Dominican American">Dominican American</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Puerto_Rican_migration_to_New_York_City" title="Puerto Rican migration to New York City">Puerto Rican American</a>, and South American<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-autogenerated1_278-2"><a href="#cite_note-autogenerated1-278">[276]</a></sup> and second-largest overall <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_American" title="Hispanic and Latino American">Hispanic</a> population in the United States, numbering 4.8 million;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-HispanicLatino_293-1"><a href="#cite_note-HispanicLatino-293">[291]</a></sup> and includes multiple established <a href="/wiki/Chinatown" title="Chinatown">Chinatowns</a> within New York City alone.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-301"><a href="#cite_note-301">[299]</a></sup>
</p>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:302px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Harlem_Street_rehearsal_(125th_street).jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="1536" data-file-width="2048" decoding="async" height="225" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Harlem_Street_rehearsal_%28125th_street%29.jpg/300px-Harlem_Street_rehearsal_%28125th_street%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Harlem_Street_rehearsal_%28125th_street%29.jpg/450px-Harlem_Street_rehearsal_%28125th_street%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/b/b4/Harlem_Street_rehearsal_%28125th_street%29.jpg/600px-Harlem_Street_rehearsal_%28125th_street%29.jpg 2x" width="300"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Harlem_Street_rehearsal_(125th_street).jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Marching_band" title="Marching band">Band rehearsal</a> on <a href="/wiki/125th_Street_(Manhattan)" title="125th Street (Manhattan)">125th Street</a> in <a href="/wiki/Harlem" title="Harlem">Harlem</a>, the historic epicenter of <a href="/wiki/African_Americans_in_New_York_City" title="African Americans in New York City">African American</a> culture. New York City is home by a significant margin to the world's largest <a href="/wiki/Black_people" title="Black people">Black</a> population of any city outside <a href="/wiki/Africa" title="Africa">Africa</a>, at over 2.2 million. <a href="/wiki/Intra-African_migration#African_migration_trends" title="Intra-African migration">African immigration to New York City</a> has contributed the majority of the Black population growth since 2000.</div></div></div>
<p>Ecuador, Colombia, Guyana, Peru, Brazil, and Venezuela are the top source countries from South America for immigrants to the New York City region; the Dominican Republic, Jamaica, Haiti, and Trinidad and Tobago in the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Caribbeans_in_New_York_City" title="Caribbeans in New York City">Caribbean</a>; Nigeria, Egypt, Ghana, Tanzania, Kenya, and South Africa from Africa; and El Salvador, Honduras, and Guatemala in Central America.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-302"><a href="#cite_note-302">[300]</a></sup> Amidst a resurgence of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Puerto_Rican_migration_to_New_York_City" title="Puerto Rican migration to New York City">Puerto Rican migration to New York City</a>, this population had increased to approximately 1.3 million in the metropolitan area as of 2013<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=New_York_City&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>. In 2022, New York City began receiving thousands of <a href="/wiki/Hispanic_and_Latino_Americans" title="Hispanic and Latino Americans">Latino</a> immigrants bused from the state of Texas, mostly originating from Venezuela, Ecuador, Columbia, and Honduras.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-303"><a href="#cite_note-303">[301]</a></sup>
</p><p>Since 2010, <a href="/wiki/Little_Australia" title="Little Australia">Little Australia</a> has emerged and is growing rapidly, representing the <a href="/wiki/Australasia" title="Australasia">Australasian</a> presence in <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Nolita,_Manhattan" title="Nolita, Manhattan">Nolita, Manhattan</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-LittleAustraliaNYC_304-0"><a href="#cite_note-LittleAustraliaNYC-304">[302]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-305"><a href="#cite_note-305">[303]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-306"><a href="#cite_note-306">[304]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-307"><a href="#cite_note-307">[305]</a></sup> In 2011, there were an estimated 20,000 Australian residents of New York City, nearly quadruple the 5,537 in 2005.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-308"><a href="#cite_note-308">[306]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-309"><a href="#cite_note-309">[307]</a></sup> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Qantas_Airways" title="Qantas Airways">Qantas Airways</a> of Australia and <a href="/wiki/Air_New_Zealand" title="Air New Zealand">Air New Zealand</a> have been planning for <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Long-haul_flight" title="Long-haul flight">long-haul flights</a> from New York to <a href="/wiki/Sydney" title="Sydney">Sydney</a> and <a href="/wiki/Auckland" title="Auckland">Auckland</a>, which would both rank among the longest <a href="/wiki/Non-stop_flight" title="Non-stop flight">non-stop flights</a> in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCAucklandNonstop_310-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCAucklandNonstop-310">[308]</a></sup> A Little <a href="/wiki/Sri_Lanka" title="Sri Lanka">Sri Lanka</a> has developed in the <a href="/wiki/Tompkinsville,_Staten_Island" title="Tompkinsville, Staten Island">Tompkinsville</a> neighborhood of Staten Island.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-311"><a href="#cite_note-311">[309]</a></sup> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Le_Petit_S%C3%A9n%C3%A9gal" title="Le Petit Sénégal">Le Petit Sénégal</a>, or Little <a href="/wiki/Senegal" title="Senegal">Senegal</a>, is based in <a href="/wiki/Harlem" title="Harlem">Harlem</a>. <a href="/wiki/Richmond_Hill,_Queens" title="Richmond Hill, Queens">Richmond Hill, Queens</a> is often thought of as "Little Guyana" for its large <a href="/wiki/Guyana" title="Guyana">Guyanese</a> community,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-312"><a href="#cite_note-312">[310]</a></sup> as well as <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Punjab_Avenue" title="Punjab Avenue">Punjab Avenue (ਪੰਜਾਬ ਐਵੇਨਿਊ)</a>, or <a href="/wiki/Punjab" title="Punjab">Little Punjab</a>, for its high concentration of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Punjabi_people" title="Punjabi people">Punjabi people</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Little_Poland,_Brooklyn" title="Little Poland, Brooklyn">Little Poland</a> is expanding rapidly in <a href="/wiki/Greenpoint,_Brooklyn" title="Greenpoint, Brooklyn">Greenpoint, Brooklyn</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Sexual_orientation_and_gender_identity">Sexual orientation and gender identity</span></h3>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main articles: <a href="/wiki/LGBT_culture_in_New_York_City" title="LGBT culture in New York City">LGBT culture in New York City</a>, <a href="/wiki/Stonewall_riots" title="Stonewall riots">Stonewall riots</a>, <a href="/wiki/NYC_Pride_March" title="NYC Pride March">NYC Pride March</a>, and <a href="/wiki/List_of_LGBT_people_from_New_York_City" title="List of LGBT people from New York City">List of LGBT people from New York City</a></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Further information: <a href="/wiki/New_York_City_Drag_March" title="New York City Drag March">New York City Drag March</a>, <a href="/wiki/Queens_Liberation_Front" title="Queens Liberation Front">Queens Liberation Front</a>, <a href="/wiki/Queens_Pride_Parade" title="Queens Pride Parade">Queens Pride Parade</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Same-sex_marriage_in_New_York" title="Same-sex marriage in New York">Same-sex marriage in New York</a></div><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1096954695/mw-parser-output/.tmulti" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="thumb tmulti tright"><div class="thumbinner multiimageinner" style="width:362px;max-width:362px"><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:175px;max-width:175px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:115px;overflow:hidden"><a //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/c/cc/QueensPrideParade2018Caribbeangroup.jpg/362px-QueensPrideParade2018Caribbeangroup.jpg 2x" width="181"/></a></div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:179px;max-width:179px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:112px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d6/49.Before.DykeMarch.NYC.29June2019_%2848209469046%29.jpg/354px-49.Before.DykeMarch.NYC.29June2019_%2848209469046%29.jpg 2x" width="177"/></a></div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:179px;max-width:179px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:112px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:3-D_-_Folsom_Street_Fair.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="2848" data-file-width="4272" decoding="async" height="118" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/3-D_-_Folsom_Street_Fair.jpg/177px-3-D_-_Folsom_Street_Fair.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/3-D_-_Folsom_Street_Fair.jpg/266px-3-D_-_Folsom_Street_Fair.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/0c/3-D_-_Folsom_Street_Fair.jpg/354px-3-D_-_Folsom_Street_Fair.jpg 2x" width="177"/></a></div></div></div><div class="trow"><div class="tsingle" style="width:183px;max-width:183px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:115px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:NYC_Pride_Parade_2018_-_New_York_University_group_2.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="3024" data-file-width="4032" decoding="async" height="136" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/NYC_Pride_Parade_2018_-_New_York_University_group_2.jpg/181px-NYC_Pride_Parade_2018_-_New_York_University_group_2.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/NYC_Pride_Parade_2018_-_New_York_University_group_2.jpg/272px-NYC_Pride_Parade_2018_-_New_York_University_group_2.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/3/38/NYC_Pride_Parade_2018_-_New_York_University_group_2.jpg/362px-NYC_Pride_Parade_2018_-_New_York_University_group_2.jpg 2x" width="181"/></a></div></div><div class="tsingle" style="width:175px;max-width:175px"><div class="thumbimage" style="height:115px;overflow:hidden"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:June_3,_2018_Queens_Pride_Parade.jpg"><img alt="" data-file-height="1601" data-file-width="2400" decoding="async" height="115" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/June_3%2C_2018_Queens_Pride_Parade.jpg/173px-June_3%2C_2018_Queens_Pride_Parade.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/June_3%2C_2018_Queens_Pride_Parade.jpg/260px-June_3%2C_2018_Queens_Pride_Parade.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/9/91/June_3%2C_2018_Queens_Pride_Parade.jpg/346px-June_3%2C_2018_Queens_Pride_Parade.jpg 2x" width="173"/></a></div></div></div><div class="trow" style="display:flex"><div class="thumbcaption">Clockwise, from upper left: <a href="/wiki/Filipinos_in_the_New_York_metropolitan_area" title="Filipinos in the New York metropolitan area">Philippine</a>-born <a href="/wiki/Geena_Rocero" title="Geena Rocero">Geena Rocero</a> introducing <a href="/wiki/International_Transgender_Day_of_Visibility" title="International Transgender Day of Visibility">International Transgender Day of Visibility</a>; <a href="/wiki/Caribbean_people" title="Caribbean people">Caribbean NYC-LGBTQ Equality Project</a>; Spectators at a <a href="/wiki/BDSM" title="BDSM">BDSM</a> street fair in <a href="/wiki/Lower_Manhattan" title="Lower Manhattan">Lower Manhattan</a>; the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ethnic_diversity" title="Ethnic diversity">Multicultural Festival</a> at the 2018 <a href="/wiki/Queens_Pride_Parade" title="Queens Pride Parade">Queens Pride Parade</a>; <a href="/wiki/NYC_Pride_March" title="NYC Pride March">NYC Pride March</a> in Manhattan, the world's largest;<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCWorld_28-1"><a href="#cite_note-NYCWorld-28">[28]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCWorld'sMediaCapitalLargestPrideParade_313-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCWorld'sMediaCapitalLargestPrideParade-313">[311]</a></sup> and the <a href="/wiki/LGBT_culture_in_New_York_City#New_York_City_Dyke_March" title="LGBT culture in New York City">NYC Dyke March</a>, the world’s largest celebration of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Lesbian_pride" title="Lesbian pride">lesbian pride</a> and culture<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCWorldsLargestLesbianPride_314-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCWorldsLargestLesbianPride-314">[312]</a></sup></div></div></div></div>
<p>New York City is home to one of the largest <a href="/wiki/LGBT_culture_in_New_York_City" title="LGBT culture in New York City">LGBTQ</a> populations in the world and the most prominent. The New York metropolitan area is home to about 570,000 self-identifying <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gays_in_New_York_City" title="Gays in New York City">gay</a> and <a href="/wiki/Bisexuality" title="Bisexuality">bisexual</a> people, <a href="/wiki/LGBT_demographics_of_the_United_States#By_metropolitan_area" title="LGBT demographics of the United States">the largest U.S. metropolitan LGBT population</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-315"><a href="#cite_note-315">[313]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-316"><a href="#cite_note-316">[314]</a></sup> Same-sex sexual activity between consenting adults has been legal in New York since the <i><a href="/wiki/New_York_v._Onofre" title="New York v. Onofre">New York v. Onofre</a></i> case in 1980, which invalidated the state's <a href="/wiki/Sodomy_laws_in_the_United_States#State_and_territorial_laws_prior_to_Lawrence_v._Texas" title="Sodomy laws in the United States">sodomy law</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-317"><a href="#cite_note-317">[315]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Same-sex_marriage_in_New_York" title="Same-sex marriage in New York">Same-sex marriages in New York</a> were legalized on June 24, 2011, and were authorized to take place on July 23, 2011.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-318"><a href="#cite_note-318">[316]</a></sup> Brian Silverman, the author of <i>Frommer's New York City from $90 a Day,</i> wrote the city has "one of the world's largest, loudest, and most powerful LGBT communities", and "Gay and lesbian culture is as much a part of New York's basic identity as <a href="/wiki/Yellow_cab" title="Yellow cab">yellow cabs</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/High-rise_building" title="High-rise building">high-rise buildings</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Broadway_theatre" title="Broadway theatre">Broadway theatre</a>".<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-319"><a href="#cite_note-319">[317]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/LGBT_culture_in_New_York_City" title="LGBT culture in New York City">LGBT</a> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/LGBT_travel" title="LGBT travel">travel guide</a> <i>Queer in the World</i> states,  "The fabulosity of Gay New York is unrivaled on Earth, and <a href="/wiki/LGBT_culture" title="LGBT culture">queer culture</a> seeps into every corner of its five boroughs".<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-320"><a href="#cite_note-320">[318]</a></sup> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/LGBT_activism" title="LGBT activism">LGBT advocate</a> and entertainer <a href="/wiki/Madonna_as_a_gay_icon" title="Madonna as a gay icon">Madonna</a> stated <a href="/wiki/Metaphor" title="Metaphor">metaphorically</a>, "Anyways, not only is New York City the best place in the world because of the queer people here. Let me tell you something, if you can make it here, then you must be queer."<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-321"><a href="#cite_note-321">[319]</a></sup>
</p><p>The annual <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_York_City_Pride_March" title="New York City Pride March">New York City Pride March</a> (or <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_York_City_LGBT_Pride_March" title="New York City LGBT Pride March">gay</a> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Pride_march" title="Pride march">pride parade</a>) proceeds southward down <a href="/wiki/Fifth_Avenue" title="Fifth Avenue">Fifth Avenue</a> and ends at <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Greenwich_Village,_Manhattan" title="Greenwich Village, Manhattan">Greenwich Village</a> in Lower Manhattan; the parade rivals the <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Sao_Paulo_Gay_Pride_Parade" title="Sao Paulo Gay Pride Parade">Sao Paulo Gay Pride Parade</a> as the largest pride parade in the world, attracting tens of thousands of participants and millions of sidewalk spectators each June.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCWorld'sLargestPrideParade_322-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCWorld'sLargestPrideParade-322">[320]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCWorld_28-2"><a href="#cite_note-NYCWorld-28">[28]</a></sup> The annual <a href="/wiki/Queens_Pride_Parade" title="Queens Pride Parade">Queens Pride Parade</a> is held in <a href="/wiki/Jackson_Heights,_Queens" title="Jackson Heights, Queens">Jackson Heights</a> and is accompanied by the ensuing <i>Multicultural Parade</i>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCTrans_323-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCTrans-323">[321]</a></sup>
</p><p><a href="/wiki/Stonewall_50_%E2%80%93_WorldPride_NYC_2019" title="Stonewall 50 – WorldPride NYC 2019">Stonewall 50 – WorldPride NYC 2019</a> was the <a href="/wiki/List_of_largest_LGBT_events" title="List of largest LGBT events">largest international Pride celebration</a> in history, produced by <a href="/wiki/Heritage_of_Pride" title="Heritage of Pride">Heritage of Pride</a> and enhanced through a partnership with the <a href="/wiki/I_Love_New_York" title="I Love New York">I <span style="color:red;">❤</span> NY</a> program's LGBT division, commemorating the 50th anniversary of the Stonewall uprising, with 150,000 participants and five million spectators attending in Manhattan alone.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Authorities1_324-0"><a href="#cite_note-Authorities1-324">[322]</a></sup> New York City is also home to the largest <a href="/wiki/Transgender" title="Transgender">transgender</a> population in the world, estimated at more than 50,000 in 2018, concentrated in Manhattan and Queens; however, until the June 1969 Stonewall riots, this community had felt marginalized and neglected by the gay community.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCTrans_323-1"><a href="#cite_note-NYCTrans-323">[321]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-TransEqualityNYC_127-1"><a href="#cite_note-TransEqualityNYC-127">[127]</a></sup> Brooklyn Liberation March, the largest <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Transgender_rights" title="Transgender rights">transgender-rights</a> demonstration in LGBTQ history, took place on June 14, 2020, stretching from <a href="/wiki/Grand_Army_Plaza" title="Grand Army Plaza">Grand Army Plaza</a> to <a href="/wiki/Fort_Greene,_Brooklyn" title="Fort Greene, Brooklyn">Fort Greene, Brooklyn</a>, focused on supporting Black transgender lives, drawing an estimated 15,000 to 20,000 participants.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-325"><a href="#cite_note-325">[323]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-326"><a href="#cite_note-326">[324]</a></sup>
</p>

<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Christianity">Christianity</span></h4>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Further information: <a href="/wiki/St._Patrick%27s_Cathedral_(Midtown_Manhattan)" title="St. Patrick's Cathedral (Midtown Manhattan)">St. Patrick's Cathedral (Midtown Manhattan)</a>, <a href="/wiki/Rockefeller_Center_Christmas_Tree" title="Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree">Rockefeller Center Christmas Tree</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Christmas_in_New_York" title="Christmas in New York">Christmas in New York</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:StPatCathExt1.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="650" data-file-width="443" decoding="async" height="323" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/StPatCathExt1.jpg/220px-StPatCathExt1.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/StPatCathExt1.jpg/330px-StPatCathExt1.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/e/ee/StPatCathExt1.jpg/440px-StPatCathExt1.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:StPatCathExt1.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/New_York_City_Landmarks" title="New York City Landmarks">landmark</a> <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gothic_revival_architecture" title="Gothic revival architecture">Neo-Gothic</a> Roman Catholic <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/St._Patrick%27s_Cathedral_(Manhattan)" title="St. Patrick's Cathedral (Manhattan)">St. Patrick's Cathedral</a>, Midtown Manhattan</div></div></div>
<p>Largely as a result of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Western_European" title="Western European">Western European</a> <a href="/wiki/Missionary" title="Missionary">missionary</a> work and <a href="/wiki/Colonialism" title="Colonialism">colonialism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Christianity" title="Christianity">Christianity</a> is the largest religion in New York City.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCReligion1_327-1"><a href="#cite_note-NYCReligion1-327">[325]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Catholic_Church" title="Catholic Church">Roman Catholicism</a> is the largest Christian denomination (33%), followed by <a href="/wiki/Protestantism" title="Protestantism">Protestantism</a> (23%), and <a href="/wiki/List_of_Christian_denominations" title="List of Christian denominations">other Christians</a> (3%). The Roman Catholic population are primarily served by the <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Archdiocese_of_New_York" title="Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York">Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New York</a> and <a href="/wiki/Roman_Catholic_Diocese_of_Brooklyn" title="Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn">Diocese of Brooklyn</a>. <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Catholic_Churches" title="Eastern Catholic Churches">Eastern Catholics</a> are divided into numerous jurisdictions throughout the city. <a href="/wiki/Evangelicalism" title="Evangelicalism">Evangelical Protestantism</a> is the largest branch of Protestantism in the city (9%), followed by <a href="/wiki/Mainline_Protestant" title="Mainline Protestant">Mainline Protestantism</a> (8%), while the converse is usually true for other cities and metropolitan areas.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCReligion2_328-1"><a href="#cite_note-NYCReligion2-328">[326]</a></sup> In Evangelicalism, <a href="/wiki/Baptists" title="Baptists">Baptists</a> are the largest group; in Mainline Protestantism, <a href="/wiki/Calvinism" title="Calvinism">Reformed Protestants</a> compose the largest subset. The majority of historically <a href="/wiki/Black_church" title="Black church">African American churches</a> are affiliated with the <a href="/wiki/National_Baptist_Convention,_USA,_Inc." title="National Baptist Convention, USA, Inc.">National Baptist Convention (USA)</a> and <a href="/wiki/Progressive_National_Baptist_Convention" title="Progressive National Baptist Convention">Progressive National Baptist Convention</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Church_of_God_in_Christ" title="Church of God in Christ">Church of God in Christ</a> is one of the largest predominantly Black <a href="/wiki/Pentecostalism" title="Pentecostalism">Pentecostal</a> denominations in the area. Approximately 1% of the population is <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Mormon" title="Mormon">Mormon</a>. The <a href="/wiki/Greek_Orthodox_Archdiocese_of_America" title="Greek Orthodox Archdiocese of America">Greek Orthodox Archdiocese of America</a> and other Orthodox Christians (mainstream and independent) were the largest <a href="/wiki/Eastern_Christianity" title="Eastern Christianity">Eastern Christian</a> groups. The <a href="/wiki/American_Orthodox_Catholic_Church" title="American Orthodox Catholic Church">American Orthodox Catholic Church</a> (initially led by <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Aftimios_Ofiesh" title="Aftimios Ofiesh">Aftimios Ofiesh</a>) was founded in New York City in 1927.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Judaism">Judaism</span></h4>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Judaism_in_New_York_City" title="Judaism in New York City">Judaism in New York City</a></div>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="768" data-file-width="1024" decoding="async" height="165" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg/220px-Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg/330px-Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/79/Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg/440px-Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Jueus_ultraortodoxes_satmar_a_brooklyn.jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Haredi_Jews" title="Haredi Jews">Ultra-Orthodox</a> <a href="/wiki/Jews_in_New_York_City" title="Jews in New York City">Jewish</a> residents in Brooklyn, nicknamed "the most <a href="/wiki/Jews_in_New_York_City" title="Jews in New York City">Jewish</a> spot on Earth",<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-BrookynTheMostJewishSpotOnEarth_329-0"><a href="#cite_note-BrookynTheMostJewishSpotOnEarth-329">[327]</a></sup> and home to the largest Jewish community outside <a href="/wiki/Israel" title="Israel">Israel</a>, with approximately 600,000 adherents living in the <a href="/wiki/Boroughs_of_New_York_City" title="Boroughs of New York City">borough</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-BrooklynJewish_330-0"><a href="#cite_note-BrooklynJewish-330">[328]</a></sup></div></div></div>
<p><a href="/wiki/American_Jews" title="American Jews">Judaism</a>, with approximately 1.1 million <a href="/wiki/Jews_in_New_York_City" title="Jews in New York City">adherents</a>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-331"><a href="#cite_note-331">[329]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-332"><a href="#cite_note-332">[330]</a></sup> more than half of whom live in <a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">Brooklyn</a>, is the second-largest religion practiced in New York City and represents the largest metropolitan Jewish population outside <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Tel_Aviv,_Israel" title="Tel Aviv, Israel">Tel Aviv, Israel</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-BrooklynJewish_330-1"><a href="#cite_note-BrooklynJewish-330">[328]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-BrookynTheMostJewishSpotOnEarth_329-1"><a href="#cite_note-BrookynTheMostJewishSpotOnEarth-329">[327]</a></sup> The ethno-religious population makes up 18.4% of the city and its religious demographic makes up 8%.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-333"><a href="#cite_note-333">[331]</a></sup> The first recorded Jewish settler was <a href="/wiki/Jacob_Barsimson" title="Jacob Barsimson">Jacob Barsimson</a>, who arrived in August 1654 on a passport from the Dutch West India Company.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-334"><a href="#cite_note-334">[332]</a></sup> Following the assassination of <a href="/wiki/Alexander_II_of_Russia" title="Alexander II of Russia">Alexander II of Russia</a>, for which many blamed "the Jews", the 36 years beginning in 1881 experienced the largest wave of Jewish immigration to the United States.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-335"><a href="#cite_note-335">[333]</a></sup> In 2012, the largest Jewish denominations were <a href="/wiki/Orthodox_Judaism" title="Orthodox Judaism">Orthodox</a>, <a href="/wiki/Haredi_Judaism" title="Haredi Judaism">Haredi</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Conservative_Judaism" title="Conservative Judaism">Conservative Judaism</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-336"><a href="#cite_note-336">[334]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Reform_Judaism" title="Reform Judaism">Reform Jewish</a> communities are prevalent through the area. <a href="/wiki/Congregation_Emanu-El_of_New_York" title="Congregation Emanu-El of New York">Congregation Emanu-El of New York</a> in Manhattan is the largest Reform synagogue in the world.
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Islam">Islam</span></h4>
<div class="thumb tright"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="2388" data-file-width="2073" decoding="async" height="253" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG/220px-Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG/330px-Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/7/76/Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG/440px-Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Islamic_Cultural_Center_E96_jeh.JPG" title="Enlarge"></a></div>The <a href="/wiki/Islamic_Cultural_Center_of_New_York" title="Islamic Cultural Center of New York">Islamic Cultural Center of New York</a> in <a href="/wiki/Upper_Manhattan" title="Upper Manhattan">Upper Manhattan</a> was the first mosque built in New York City.</div></div></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_New_York_City" title="Islam in New York City">Islam in New York City</a></div>
<p><a href="/wiki/Islam" title="Islam">Islam</a> ranks as the third largest religion in New York City, following Christianity and Judaism, with estimates ranging between 600,000 and 1,000,000 observers of Islam, including 10% of the city's public school children.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-337"><a href="#cite_note-337">[335]</a></sup> Given both the size and scale of the city, as well as its relative proxinity and accessibility by <a href="/wiki/Aviation" title="Aviation">air transportation</a> to the <a href="/wiki/Middle_East" title="Middle East">Middle East</a>, <a href="/wiki/North_Africa" title="North Africa">North Africa</a>, <a href="/wiki/Central_Asia" title="Central Asia">Central Asia</a>, and <a href="/wiki/South_Asia" title="South Asia">South Asia</a>, 22.3% of <a href="/wiki/Islam_in_the_United_States" title="Islam in the United States">American Muslims</a> live in New York City, with 1.5 million Muslims in the greater <a href="/wiki/New_York_metropolitan_area" title="New York metropolitan area">New York metropolitan area</a>, representing the largest metropolitan Muslim population in the <a href="/wiki/Western_Hemisphere" title="Western Hemisphere">Western Hemisphere</a><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-338"><a href="#cite_note-338">[336]</a></sup> —and the most <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Ethnically_diverse" title="Ethnically diverse">ethnically diverse</a> Muslim population of any city in the world.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCMostDiverseMuslimPopulationWorld_339-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCMostDiverseMuslimPopulationWorld-339">[337]</a></sup> <a href="/wiki/Powers_Street_Mosque" title="Powers Street Mosque">Powers Street Mosque</a> in Brooklyn is one of the oldest continuously operating mosques in the U.S., and represents the first Islamic organization in both the city and the state of New York.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-340"><a href="#cite_note-340">[338]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-341"><a href="#cite_note-341">[339]</a></sup>
</p>
<h4><span class="mw-headline" id="Hinduism_and_other_religious_affiliations">Hinduism and other religious affiliations</span></h4>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America" title="Hindu Temple Society of North America">Hindu Temple Society of North America</a></div>
<div class="thumb tleft"><div class="thumbinner" style="width:222px;"><a class="image" href="/wiki/File:Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America_(Flushing,_Queens_-_exterior).jpg"><img alt="" class="thumbimage" data-file-height="4752" data-file-width="3168" decoding="async" height="330" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America_%28Flushing%2C_Queens_-_exterior%29.jpg/220px-Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America_%28Flushing%2C_Queens_-_exterior%29.jpg" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America_%28Flushing%2C_Queens_-_exterior%29.jpg/330px-Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America_%28Flushing%2C_Queens_-_exterior%29.jpg 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1f/Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America_%28Flushing%2C_Queens_-_exterior%29.jpg/440px-Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America_%28Flushing%2C_Queens_-_exterior%29.jpg 2x" width="220"/></a> <div class="thumbcaption"><div class="magnify"><a class="internal" href="/wiki/File:Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America_(Flushing,_Queens_-_exterior).jpg" title="Enlarge"></a></div><a href="/wiki/Hindu_Temple_Society_of_North_America" title="Hindu Temple Society of North America">Ganesha Temple</a> in <a href="/wiki/Flushing,_Queens" title="Flushing, Queens">Flushing, Queens</a>, is the oldest <a href="/wiki/Hindu_temple" title="Hindu temple">Hindu temple</a> in the <a href="/wiki/Western_Hemisphere" title="Western Hemisphere">Western Hemisphere</a>.</div></div></div>
<p>Following these three largest religious groups in New York City are <a href="/wiki/Hinduism" title="Hinduism">Hinduism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Buddhism" title="Buddhism">Buddhism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Sikhism" title="Sikhism">Sikhism</a>, <a href="/wiki/Zoroastrianism" title="Zoroastrianism">Zoroastrianism</a>, and a variety of other religions, as well as atheism. In 2014, 24% of New Yorkers identified with no organized religious affiliation; a little over 3% of New Yorkers were <a href="/wiki/Atheism" title="Atheism">atheist</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCReligion1_327-2"><a href="#cite_note-NYCReligion1-327">[325]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Wealth_and_income_disparity">Wealth and income disparity</span></h3>
<p>New York City, like other large cities, has a high degree of <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Income_disparity" title="Income disparity">income disparity</a>, as indicated by its <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Gini_Coefficient" title="Gini Coefficient">Gini coefficient</a> of 0.55 as of 2017.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-342"><a href="#cite_note-342">[340]</a></sup> In the first quarter of 2014, the average weekly wage in New York County (Manhattan) was $2,749, representing the highest total among large counties in the United States.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-343"><a href="#cite_note-343">[341]</a></sup> As of 2017, New York City was home to the highest number of <a href="/wiki/Billionaire" title="Billionaire">billionaires</a> of any city in the world at 103,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCBillionaires_344-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCBillionaires-344">[342]</a></sup> including former <a href="/wiki/Mayor_of_New_York_City" title="Mayor of New York City">Mayor</a> <a href="/wiki/Michael_Bloomberg" title="Michael Bloomberg">Michael Bloomberg</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-345"><a href="#cite_note-345">[343]</a></sup> New York also had the highest density of millionaires per capita among major U.S. cities in 2014, at 4.6% of residents.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-346"><a href="#cite_note-346">[344]</a></sup> New York City is one of the relatively few American cities levying an <a href="/wiki/Income_tax" title="Income tax">income tax</a> (about 3%) on its residents.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-Localities_with_INCOME_tax_347-0"><a href="#cite_note-Localities_with_INCOME_tax-347">[345]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYCTax_348-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYCTax-348">[346]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NYC_tax_schedule_349-0"><a href="#cite_note-NYC_tax_schedule-349">[347]</a></sup> As of 2018, there were 78,676 <a href="/wiki/Homelessness_in_the_United_States" title="Homelessness in the United States">homeless people</a> in New York City.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-350"><a href="#cite_note-350">[348]</a></sup>
</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Economy">Economy</span></h2>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Main article: <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_New_York_City" title="Economy of New York City">Economy of New York City</a></div>
<link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1033289096" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="hatnote navigation-not-searchable" role="note">Further information: <a href="/wiki/Economy_of_Long_Island" title="Economy of Long Island">Economy of Long Island</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Economy_of_New_York_State" title="Economy of New York State">Economy of New York State</a></div>

</td></tr></tbody></table>
<p>New York City is a <a href="/wiki/Global_city" title="Global city">global hub</a> of business and commerce and an established <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Safe_haven_currency" title="Safe haven currency">safe haven</a> for global investors,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-NewYorkSafeHaven_13-1"><a href="#cite_note-NewYorkSafeHaven-13">[13]</a></sup> and is sometimes described as the <a href="/wiki/Caput_Mundi#New_York_City" title="Caput Mundi">capital of the world</a>. The city is a center for worldwide banking and finance, retailing, world trade, transportation, tourism, real estate, <a href="/wiki/New_media" title="New media">new media</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Traditional_media" title="Traditional media">traditional media</a>, advertising, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Legal_services" title="Legal services">legal services</a>, <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Accountancy" title="Accountancy">accountancy</a>, insurance, both <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Musical_theater" title="Musical theater">musical</a> and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Straight_play" title="Straight play">prose</a> <a href="/wiki/Broadway_theatre" title="Broadway theatre">theater</a>, <a href="/wiki/Fashion" title="Fashion">fashion</a>, and the arts in the United States; while <a href="/wiki/Silicon_Alley" title="Silicon Alley">Silicon Alley</a>, metonymous for New York's broad-spectrum <a href="/wiki/High_tech" title="High tech">high technology</a> sphere, continues to expand. The <a href="/wiki/Port_of_New_York_and_New_Jersey" title="Port of New York and New Jersey">Port of New York and New Jersey</a> is also a major economic engine, handling record cargo volume in 2017, over 6.7 million <a href="/wiki/Twenty-foot_equivalent_unit" title="Twenty-foot equivalent unit">TEUs</a>, benefitting <a href="/wiki/Panamax" title="Panamax">post-Panamax</a> from the expansion of the <a href="/wiki/Panama_Canal" title="Panama Canal">Panama Canal</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-352"><a href="#cite_note-352">[350]</a></sup>
</p><p>Many <a href="/wiki/Fortune_500" title="Fortune 500">Fortune 500</a> corporations are headquartered in New York City,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-353"><a href="#cite_note-353">[351]</a></sup> as are a large number of <a href="/wiki/Multinational_corporation" title="Multinational corporation">multinational corporations</a>. One out of ten <a href="/wiki/Private_sector" title="Private sector">private sector</a> jobs in the city is with a foreign company.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-354"><a href="#cite_note-354">[352]</a></sup> New York City has been ranked first among cities across the globe in attracting <a href="/wiki/Capital_(economics)" title="Capital (economics)">capital</a>, business, and tourists.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-355"><a href="#cite_note-355">[353]</a></sup><sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-356"><a href="#cite_note-356">[354]</a></sup> New York City's role as the top global center for the <a href="/wiki/Advertising" title="Advertising">advertising industry</a> is metonymously reflected as <a href="/wiki/Madison_Avenue#Advertising_industry" title="Madison Avenue">"Madison Avenue"</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-MadisonAveMetonym_357-0"><a href="#cite_note-MadisonAveMetonym-357">[355]</a></sup> The city's <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Fashion_industry" title="Fashion industry">fashion industry</a> provides approximately 180,000 employees with $11 billion in annual wages.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-358"><a href="#cite_note-358">[356]</a></sup> The non-profit <a href="/wiki/Partnership_for_New_York_City" title="Partnership for New York City">Partnership for New York City</a>, currently headed by <a href="/wiki/Kathryn_Wylde" title="Kathryn Wylde">Kathryn Wylde</a>, is the city's pre-eminent private business association, comprising approximately 330 corporate leaders in membership. The <a href="/wiki/New_York_Fashion_Week" title="New York Fashion Week">fashion industry</a> is based in Midtown Manhattan and is represented by the <a href="/wiki/Council_of_Fashion_Designers_of_America" title="Council of Fashion Designers of America">Council of Fashion Designers of America</a> (CDFA), headquartered in Lower Manhattan.
</p><p>Other important economic sectors include <a href="/wiki/Medical_research" title="Medical research">medical research</a> and technology, non-profit institutions, and universities. Manufacturing accounts for a significant but declining share of employment. The city's apparel and <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/Garment_industry" title="Garment industry">garment industry</a>, historically centered on the <a href="/wiki/Garment_District,_Manhattan" title="Garment District, Manhattan">Garment District</a> in Manhattan, peaked in 1950, when more than 323,000 workers were employed in the industry in New York. In 2015, fewer than 23,000 New York City residents were employed in the manufacture of garments, accessories, and finished textiles, although efforts to revive the industry were underway.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-359"><a href="#cite_note-359">[357]</a></sup> Food processing is a $5 billion industry that employs more than 19,000 residents.
</p><p>Chocolate is New York City's leading <a href="/wiki/Specialty_Food_Association" title="Specialty Food Association">specialty-food</a> export, with up to $234 million worth of exports each year.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-food_manufacturing_360-0"><a href="#cite_note-food_manufacturing-360">[358]</a></sup> Entrepreneurs were forming a "Chocolate District" in <a href="/wiki/Brooklyn" title="Brooklyn">Brooklyn</a> as of 2014<sup class="plainlinks noexcerpt noprint asof-tag update" style="display:none;"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=New_York_City&amp;action=edit">[update]</a></sup>,<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-361"><a href="#cite_note-361">[359]</a></sup> while <a href="/wiki/Godiva_Chocolatier" title="Godiva Chocolatier">Godiva</a>, one of the world's largest <a href="/wiki/Chocolatier" title="Chocolatier">chocolatiers</a>, continues to be headquartered in <a href="/wiki/Manhattan" title="Manhattan">Manhattan</a>.<sup class="reference" id="cite_ref-362"><a href="#cite_note-362">[360]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Wall_Street">Wall Street</span></h3>
