<li id="cite_note-382"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-382">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFQuirk2007">Quirk, James (July 5, 2007). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20071222235142/http://www.northjersey.com/page.php?qstr=eXJpcnk3ZjczN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXk4NDImZmdiZWw3Zjd2cWVlRUV5eTcxNjI5NzEmeXJpcnk3ZjcxN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXkyMg%3D%3D" rel="nofollow">"Bergen offices have plenty of space"</a>. <i><a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/The_Record_(Bergen_County)" title="The Record (Bergen County)">The Record (Bergen County)</a></i>. <a href="/wiki/North_Jersey_Media_Group" title="North Jersey Media Group">North Jersey Media Group</a>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.northjersey.com/page.php?qstr=eXJpcnk3ZjczN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXk4NDImZmdiZWw3Zjd2cWVlRUV5eTcxNjI5NzEmeXJpcnk3ZjcxN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXkyMg==" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on December 22, 2007<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">July 5,</span> 2007</span>. <q>On Monday, a 26-year-old, 33-story office building at 450 Park Ave. sold for a stunning $1,589 per square foot, or about $510 million. The price is believed to be the most ever paid for a U.S. office building on a per-square-foot basis. That broke the previous record—set four weeks earlier—when 660 Madison Ave. sold for $1,476 a square foot.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=The+Record+%28Bergen+County%29&amp;rft.atitle=Bergen+offices+have+plenty+of+space&amp;rft.date=2007-07-05&amp;rft.aulast=Quirk&amp;rft.aufirst=James&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.northjersey.com%2Fpage.php%3Fqstr%3DeXJpcnk3ZjczN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXk4NDImZmdiZWw3Zjd2cWVlRUV5eTcxNjI5NzEmeXJpcnk3ZjcxN2Y3dnFlZUVFeXkyMg%3D%3D&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-436"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-436">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFWinkley2016">Winkley, Lyndsay (March 5, 2016). <a class="external text" href="https://www.sandiegouniontribune.com/sdut-murders-homicide-2015-county-cities-rate-2016mar05-story.html" rel="nofollow">"San Diego County homicides up 12% in 2015"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_San_Diego_Union-Tribune" title="The San Diego Union-Tribune">The San Diego Union-Tribune</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-450"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-450">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFGardinerShallwani2014">Gardiner, Sean; Shallwani, Pervaiz (February 18, 2014). <a class="external text" href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB10001424052702304626804579363363092833756" rel="nofollow">"NY Crime: Mafia Is Down—but Not Out - Crime Families Adapt to Survive, Lowering Profile and Using Need-to-Know Tactics"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_Wall_Street_Journal" title="The Wall Street Journal">The Wall Street Journal</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. They’re also shrewd, outspoken, and proudly able to survive in a metropolis that tends to punish the meek. Residents and visitors alike can see why New York is considered the greatest city in the world.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=15+Things+NOT+to+Do+in+New+York+City&amp;rft.pub=Fodor%27s&amp;rft.date=2019-03-15&amp;rft.aulast=Chauvin&amp;rft.aufirst=Kelsy&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.fodors.com%2Fworld%2Fnorth-america%2Fusa%2Fnew-york%2Fnew-york-city%2Fexperiences%2Fnews%2F15-things-not-to-do-in-new-york-city&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-477"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-477">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation news cs1" id="CITEREFWelsh2004">Welsh, Anne Marie (June 6, 2004). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20081005110339/http://www.signonsandiego.com/news/features/20040606-9999-1a6tony.html" rel="nofollow">"2 plays + 9 nominations = good odds for locals"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/The_San_Diego_Union-Tribune" title="The San Diego Union-Tribune">The San Diego Union-Tribune</a></i>. <li id="cite_note-478"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-478">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFMcBeth2006">McBeth, VR (September 25, 2006). <a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20110504160457/http://timessquare.com/NYC__/Times_Square_History/The_Great_White_Way/" rel="nofollow">"The Great White Way"</a>. <i>TimesSquare.com</i>. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://timessquare.com/NYC__/Times_Square_History/The_Great_White_Way/" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on May 4, 2011<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">December 4,</span> 2021</span>. <q>Coined in 1901 by O.J. Gude, the designer of many prominent advertising displays, to describe the new light show that beckoned along Broadway, The Great White Way is a phrase known worldwide to describe Broadway's profusion of theaters in Times Square.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=TimesSquare.com&amp;rft.atitle=The+Great+White+Way&amp;rft.date=2006-09-25&amp;rft.aulast=McBeth&amp;rft.aufirst=VR&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Ftimessquare.com%2FNYC__%2FTimes_Square_History%2FThe_Great_White_Way%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-479"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-479">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFTell2007">Tell, Darcy (2007). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=NwaLWFSG3rcC&amp;pg=PA41" rel="nofollow"><i>Times Square Spectacular: Lighting Up Broadway</i></a>. New York: <a href="/wiki/HarperCollins" title="HarperCollins">HarperCollins</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-0608-8433-8" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-0608-8433-8"><bdi>978-0-0608-8433-8</bdi></a>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=Times+Square+Spectacular%3A+Lighting+Up+Broadway&amp;rft.place=New+York&amp;rft.pub=HarperCollins&amp;rft.date=2007&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-0608-8433-8&amp;rft.aulast=Tell&amp;rft.aufirst=Darcy&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3DNwaLWFSG3rcC%26pg%3DPA41&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-480"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-480">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation book cs1" id="CITEREFAllen1995">Allen, Irving Lewis (1995). <a class="external text" href="https://books.google.com/books?id=j41z0yeKbeIC&amp;pg=PA59" rel="nofollow"><i>The City in Slang: New York Life and Popular Speech</i></a>. New York: <a href="/wiki/Oxford_University_Press" title="Oxford University Press">Oxford University Press</a>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)" title="ISBN (identifier)">ISBN</a> <a href="/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-1953-5776-9" title="Special:BookSources/978-0-1953-5776-9"><bdi>978-0-1953-5776-9</bdi></a>. <q>By 1910, the blocks of Broadway just above 42nd Street were at the very heart of the Great White Way. The glow of Times Square symbolized the center of New York, if not of the world.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=The+City+in+Slang%3A+New+York+Life+and+Popular+Speech&amp;rft.place=New+York&amp;rft.pub=Oxford+University+Press&amp;rft.date=1995&amp;rft.isbn=978-0-1953-5776-9&amp;rft.aulast=Allen&amp;rft.aufirst=Irving+Lewis&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fbooks.google.com%2Fbooks%3Fid%3Dj41z0yeKbeIC%26pg%3DPA59&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-league-481"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-league_481-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://www.broadwayleague.com/index.php?url_identifier=calendar-year-stats-1" rel="nofollow">"Broadway Calendar-Year Statistics"</a>. <a href="/wiki/The_Broadway_League" title="The Broadway League">The Broadway League</a><span class="reference-accessdate">. <li id="cite_note-497"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-497">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFTiedemann2019">Tiedemann, Jennifer (April 8, 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://indefenseofliberty.blog/2019/04/08/15-per-hour-minimum-wage-isnt-what-nyc-restaurant-workers-ordered/" rel="nofollow">"$15-Per-Hour Minimum Wage Isn't What NYC Restaurant Workers Ordered"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Goldwater_Institute" title="Goldwater Institute">Goldwater Institute</a></i>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">June 1,</span> 2019</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Goldwater+Institute&amp;rft.atitle=%2415-Per-Hour+Minimum+Wage+Isn%27t+What+NYC+Restaurant+Workers+Ordered&amp;rft.date=2019-04-08&amp;rft.aulast=Tiedemann&amp;rft.aufirst=Jennifer&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Findefenseofliberty.blog%2F2019%2F04%2F08%2F15-per-hour-minimum-wage-isnt-what-nyc-restaurant-workers-ordered%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>

<li id="cite_note-QueensNightMarket-498"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-QueensNightMarket_498-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFGleason2019">Gleason, Will (March 11, 2019). <a class="external text" href="https://www.timeout.com/newyork/news/new-york-voted-best-city-in-the-world-in-massive-worldwide-survey-031119" rel="nofollow">"Citing its diversity and culture, NYC was voted best city in the world in new global survey"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/Time_Out_(magazine)" title="Time Out (magazine)">Time Out</a></i><span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">June 23,</span> 2019</span>. <q>Just look at the Queens Night Market, which began in the summer of 2015 as a collection of 40 vendors serving authentic and affordable international cuisine in Flushing Meadows Corona Park. Since then, it's steadily attracted more and more attendees and, last year, averaged 10,000 people a night. Those thousands of New Yorkers weren't just hungry for new food, but for new points-of-view. "When I first started, it was all about how can we attract people with an event that's as affordable and diverse as possible," says Night Market founder John Wang. "We've now been able to represent over 85 countries, and I'm constantly hearing examples of people branching out and trying things they've never heard of before.</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Ajournal&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.jtitle=Time+Out&amp;rft.atitle=Citing+its+diversity+and+culture%2C+NYC+was+voted+best+city+in+the+world+in+new+global+survey&amp;rft.date=2019-03-11&amp;rft.aulast=Gleason&amp;rft.aufirst=Will&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.timeout.com%2Fnewyork%2Fnews%2Fnew-york-voted-best-city-in-the-world-in-massive-worldwide-survey-031119&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-531"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-531">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://nhts.ornl.gov/2001/pub/STT.pdf" rel="nofollow">"2001 National Household Travel Survey: Summary of Travel Trends"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/U.S._Department_of_Transportation" title="U.S. Department of Transportation">U.S. Department of Transportation</a>. <li id="cite_note-547"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-547">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20190305195347/http://www.nyc.gov/html/dep/html/air/air_pollution_monitoring.shtml" rel="nofollow">"Air Pollution Monitoring"</a>. <i><a href="/wiki/New_York_City_Department_of_Environmental_Protection" title="New York City Department of Environmental Protection">New York City Department of Environmental Protection</a></i>. <li id="cite_note-2001summary-567"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-2001summary_567-0">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20050514220419/http://www.bts.gov/publications/highlights_of_the_2001_national_household_travel_survey/pdf/entire.pdf" rel="nofollow">"NHTS 2001 Highlights Report, BTS03-05"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a class="mw-redirect" href="/wiki/U.S._Department_of_Transportation" title="U.S. Department of Transportation">U.S. Department of Transportation</a>, <a href="/wiki/Bureau_of_Transportation_Statistics" title="Bureau of Transportation Statistics">Bureau of Transportation Statistics</a>. 2001. <li id="cite_note-568"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-568">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation report cs1"><a class="external text" href="http://comptroller.nyc.gov/wp-content/uploads/documents/Longest_Work_Weeks_March_2015.pdf" rel="nofollow">The Hardest Working Cities</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span> (Report). <a href="/wiki/New_York_City_Comptroller" title="New York City Comptroller">Office of the New York City Comptroller</a>. March 2015.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=report&amp;rft.btitle=The+Hardest+Working+Cities&amp;rft.pub=Office+of+the+New+York+City+Comptroller&amp;rft.date=2015-03&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fcomptroller.nyc.gov%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2Fdocuments%2FLongest_Work_Weeks_March_2015.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-569"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-569">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1" id="CITEREFWeinbergerKaehnyRufo2010">Weinberger, Rachel; Kaehny, John; Rufo, Matthew (2010). <a class="external text" href="http://www.infrastructureusa.org/wp-content/uploads/2010/03/itdp_parking_fullreport.pdf" rel="nofollow">"U.S. Parking Policies: An Overview of Management Strategies"</a> <span class="cs1-format">(PDF)</span>. <a href="/wiki/Institute_for_Transportation_and_Development_Policy" title="Institute for Transportation and Development Policy">Institute for Transportation and Development Policy</a>. p. 62<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">June 11,</span> 2011</span>. <q>New York City is the largest, densest and most transit- and pedestrian-oriented city in the United States. It is the only U.S. city in which a majority of households do not have a car. Despite this, New York City is very much an American city in the way it under prices and under uses curbside parking meters. Meter rates are far lower than in other leading world cities, and New York suffers from high levels of cruising and double parking (p. 62) ... Nationally 90% of households own automobiles. New Yorkers own fewer at 48% with only 22% of Manhattan residents owning automobiles (p. 78)</q></cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=U.S.+Parking+Policies%3A+An+Overview+of+Management+Strategies&amp;rft.pages=62&amp;rft.pub=Institute+for+Transportation+and+Development+Policy&amp;rft.date=2010&amp;rft.aulast=Weinberger&amp;rft.aufirst=Rachel&amp;rft.au=Kaehny%2C+John&amp;rft.au=Rufo%2C+Matthew&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.infrastructureusa.org%2Fwp-content%2Fuploads%2F2010%2F03%2Fitdp_parking_fullreport.pdf&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>
</li>

<li id="cite_note-578"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-578">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20101206022153/http://www.aci.aero/cda/aci_common/display/main/aci_content07_c.jsp?zn=aci&amp;cp=1-5-212-1376-1379_666_2__" rel="nofollow">"2011 Year-to-date International passenger Traffic (as of December 2011)"</a>. <a href="/wiki/Airports_Council_International" title="Airports Council International">Airports Council International</a>. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">August 21,</span> 2013</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=KL%27s+Sister+Cities&amp;rft.pub=poskod.my&amp;rft.date=2010-10-21&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fposkod.my%2Ffeatures%2Fkls-sister-cities%2F&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>
</li>
<li id="cite_note-614"><span class="mw-cite-backlink"><b><a href="#cite_ref-614">^</a></b></span> <span class="reference-text"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1067248974" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><cite class="citation web cs1"><a class="external text" href="https://web.archive.org/web/20131001194353/http://www.tel-aviv.gov.il/Cityhall/Pages/Partnerships.aspx?tm=&amp;sm=&amp;side=515" rel="nofollow">"(Israel) Sister Cities"</a>. Tel Aviv. Archived from <a class="external text" href="http://www.tel-aviv.gov.il/Cityhall/Pages/Partnerships.aspx?tm=&amp;sm=&amp;side=515" rel="nofollow">the original</a> on October 1, 2013<span class="reference-accessdate">. Retrieved <span class="nowrap">May 4,</span> 2013</span>.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=unknown&amp;rft.btitle=%28Israel%29+Sister+Cities&amp;rft.pub=Tel+Aviv&amp;rft_id=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.tel-aviv.gov.il%2FCityhall%2FPages%2FPartnerships.aspx%3Ftm%3D%26sm%3D%26side%3D515&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span></span>
</li>
</ol></div></div>

Putnam.</cite><span class="Z3988" title="ctx_ver=Z39.88-2004&amp;rft_val_fmt=info%3Aofi%2Ffmt%3Akev%3Amtx%3Abook&amp;rft.genre=book&amp;rft.btitle=New+York%2C+Past%2C+Present%2C+and+Future%3A+Comprising+a+History+of+the+City+of+New+York%2C+a+Description+of+its+Present+Condition%2C+and+an+Estimate+of+its+Future+Increase&amp;rft.place=New+York&amp;rft.pub=G.P.+Putnam&amp;rft.date=1849&amp;rft.aulast=Belden&amp;rft.aufirst=E.+Porter&amp;rft_id=https%3A%2F%2Farchive.org%2Fdetails%2Fbub_gb_Jv-nXd8W8b0C&amp;rfr_id=info%3Asid%2Fen.wikipedia.org%3ANew+York+City"></span> From <a href="/wiki/Google_Books" title="Google Books">Google Books</a>.</li>

<ul><li><b><a href="/wiki/1960_Summer_Paralympics" title="1960 Summer Paralympics">1960</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Italy" title="Italy"><img alt="Italy" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="1000" data-file-width="1500" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/23px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/35px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/0/03/Flag_of_Italy.svg/45px-Flag_of_Italy.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Rome" title="Rome">Rome</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/1964_Summer_Paralympics" title="1964 Summer Paralympics">1964</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Japan" title="Japan"><img alt="Japan" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="700" data-file-width="1000" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Flag_of_Japan_%281870%E2%80%931999%29.svg/22px-Flag_of_Japan_%281870%E2%80%931999%29.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Flag_of_Japan_%281870%E2%80%931999%29.svg/33px-Flag_of_Japan_%281870%E2%80%931999%29.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/1/1b/Flag_of_Japan_%281870%E2%80%931999%29.svg/43px-Flag_of_Japan_%281870%E2%80%931999%29.svg.png 2x" width="22"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Tokyo" title="Tokyo">Tokyo</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/1968_Summer_Paralympics" title="1968 Summer Paralympics">1968</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Israel" title="Israel"><img alt="Israel" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="800" data-file-width="1100" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/21px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/32px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/d/d4/Flag_of_Israel.svg/41px-Flag_of_Israel.svg.png 2x" width="21"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Tel_Aviv" title="Tel Aviv">Tel Aviv</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/1972_Summer_Paralympics" title="1972 Summer Paralympics">1972</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/West_Germany" title="West Germany"><img alt="West Germany" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1000" decoding="async" height="14" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/23px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/35px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/b/ba/Flag_of_Germany.svg/46px-Flag_of_Germany.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Heidelberg" title="Heidelberg">Heidelberg</a></li>

<li><b><a href="/wiki/1984_Summer_Paralympics" title="1984 Summer Paralympics">1984</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/United_States" title="United States"><img alt="United States" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="650" data-file-width="1235" decoding="async" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/a4/Flag_of_the_United_States.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_States.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a class="mw-selflink selflink">New York City</a> / <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/United_Kingdom" title="United Kingdom"><img alt="United Kingdom" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="1200" decoding="async" height="12" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/23px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/35px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/a/ae/Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg/46px-Flag_of_the_United_Kingdom.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Stoke_Mandeville" title="Stoke Mandeville">Stoke Mandeville</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/1988_Summer_Paralympics" title="1988 Summer Paralympics">1988</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/South_Korea" title="South Korea"><img alt="South Korea" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="600" data-file-width="900" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Flag_of_South_Korea.svg/23px-Flag_of_South_Korea.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Flag_of_South_Korea.svg/35px-Flag_of_South_Korea.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/thumb/0/09/Flag_of_South_Korea.svg/45px-Flag_of_South_Korea.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Seoul" title="Seoul">Seoul</a></li>
<li><b><a href="/wiki/1992_Summer_Paralympics" title="1992 Summer Paralympics">1992</a>:</b> <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Spain" title="Spain"><img alt="Spain" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="500" data-file-width="750" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/23px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/35px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/45px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Barcelona" title="Barcelona">Barcelona</a> / <span class="flagicon"><a href="/wiki/Spain" title="Spain"><img alt="Spain" class="thumbborder" data-file-height="500" data-file-width="750" decoding="async" height="15" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/23px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/35px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/9a/Flag_of_Spain.svg/45px-Flag_of_Spain.svg.png 2x" width="23"/></a></span> <a href="/wiki/Madrid" title="Madrid">Madrid</a></li>

<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Location_of_the_capital_of_the_United_States" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Location_of_US_capital" title="Template:Location of US capital"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Location_of_US_capital" title="Template talk:Location of US capital"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Location_of_US_capital&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Location_of_the_capital_of_the_United_States" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/List_of_capitals_in_the_United_States" title="List of capitals in the United States">Location of the capital of the United States</a></div></th></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Temporary_capital" title="Temporary capital">Temporary capitals</a></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Philadelphia" title="Philadelphia">Philadelphia</a> (1776; 1777; 1778–1783; 1791–1800)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Baltimore" title="Baltimore">Baltimore</a> (1776–77)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Lancaster,_Pennsylvania" title="Lancaster, Pennsylvania">Lancaster</a> (1777)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/York,_Pennsylvania" title="York, Pennsylvania">York</a> (1777–78)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Princeton,_New_Jersey" title="Princeton, New Jersey">Princeton</a> (1783)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Annapolis,_Maryland" title="Annapolis, Maryland">Annapolis</a> (1783–84)</li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Trenton,_New_Jersey" title="Trenton, New Jersey">Trenton</a> (1784–85)</li>
<li><a class="mw-selflink selflink">New York City</a> (1785–91)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%"><a href="/wiki/Capital_city" title="Capital city">Permanent capital</a></th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Washington,_D.C." title="Washington, D.C.">Washington, D.C.</a> (since 1800)</li></ul>
</div></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div class="navbox-styles nomobile"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1061467846" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/></div><div aria-labelledby="Northeast_megalopolis_major_urban_regions" class="navbox" role="navigation" style="padding:3px"><table class="nowraplinks mw-collapsible autocollapse navbox-inner" style="border-spacing:0;background:transparent;color:inherit"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-title" colspan="2" scope="col"><link href="mw-data:TemplateStyles:r1063604349" rel="mw-deduplicated-inline-style"/><div class="navbar plainlinks hlist navbar-mini"><ul><li class="nv-view"><a href="/wiki/Template:Northeast_Megalopolis" title="Template:Northeast Megalopolis"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="View this template">v</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-talk"><a href="/wiki/Template_talk:Northeast_Megalopolis" title="Template talk:Northeast Megalopolis"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Discuss this template">t</abbr></a></li><li class="nv-edit"><a class="external text" href="https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Template:Northeast_Megalopolis&amp;action=edit"><abbr style=";;background:none transparent;border:none;box-shadow:none;padding:0;" title="Edit this template">e</abbr></a></li></ul></div><div id="Northeast_megalopolis_major_urban_regions" style="font-size:114%;margin:0 4em"><a href="/wiki/Northeast_megalopolis" title="Northeast megalopolis">Northeast megalopolis</a> major urban regions</div></th></tr><tr><td class="navbox-abovebelow" colspan="2"><div id="Core_cities_are_metropolitan_core_cities_of_at_least_a_million_people._The_other_areas_are_urban_areas_of_cities_that_have_an_urban_area_of_150,000+_or_of_a_metropolitan_area_of_at_least_250,000+._Satellite_cities_are_in_italics.">Core cities are metropolitan core cities of at least a million people. The other areas are urban areas of cities that have an urban area of 150,000+ or of a metropolitan area of at least 250,000+. Satellite cities are in italics.</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Mid-Atlantic</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd hlist" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em"></div><table class="nowraplinks navbox-subgroup" style="border-spacing:0"><tbody><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Core cities</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-odd" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Baltimore_metropolitan_area" title="Baltimore metropolitan area">Baltimore</a>

<li><a href="/wiki/Delaware_Valley" title="Delaware Valley">Delaware Valley</a>

<li><a href="/wiki/Hampton_Roads" title="Hampton Roads">Hampton Roads</a>
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Virginia_Beach,_Virginia" title="Virginia Beach, Virginia">Virginia Beach</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Norfolk,_Virginia" title="Norfolk, Virginia">Norfolk</a></li>
<li><i><a href="/wiki/Newport_News,_Virginia" title="Newport News, Virginia">Newport News</a></i></li></ul></li>

<ul><li><a class="mw-selflink selflink">city</a></li>

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">Other areas</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Atlantic_City,_New_Jersey" title="Atlantic City, New Jersey">Atlantic City</a></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Hagerstown_metropolitan_area" title="Hagerstown metropolitan area">Hagerstown</a>

<ul><li><a href="/wiki/Harrisburg,_Pennsylvania" title="Harrisburg, Pennsylvania">city</a></li></ul></li>
<li><a href="/wiki/Lancaster,_Pennsylvania" title="Lancaster, Pennsylvania">Lancaster</a></li>

</div></td></tr><tr><th class="navbox-group" scope="row" style="width:1%">National libraries</th><td class="navbox-list-with-group navbox-list navbox-even" style="width:100%;padding:0"><div style="padding:0 0.25em">
<ul><li><span class="uid"><a class="external text" href="https://authority.bibsys.no/authority/rest/authorities/html/9054633" rel="nofollow">Norway</a></span></li>
